title: Data Analyst
description: Lever builds modern recruiting software for teams to source, interview, and hire top talent. Our team strives to set a new bar for enterprise software with modern, well-designed, real-time apps. We participated in Y Combinator in summer 2012, and since then have raised $73 million. As the applicant tracking system of choice for Netflix, Eventbrite, ClearSlide, change.org, and thousands more leading companies, Lever means you hire the best by hiring together.<br><br>Lever is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please don’t hesitate to reach out! We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives. Learn more about our team culture and commitment to diversity and inclusion.

title: Technical Data Analyst
description: Required <br><br> Skills: <br><ul><li> Self-starter with the ability to research and<br><br></li></ul>recognize relevant data, data patterns and determine the value-add of those to<br><br>the overall business processes. Must be able to work independently with<br><br>stakeholders and excel through hands-on learning.<br><ul><li> Intermediate to expert knowledge of data<br><br></li></ul>collection and structuring concepts.<br><ul><li> Intermediate knowledge of data mapping and/or<br><br></li></ul>creation of a data dictionary.<br><ul><li> Intermediate knowledge of data visualization<br><br></li></ul>concepts with the ability to translate data into meaningful business context.<br><ul><li> Intermediate knowledge of structured query<br><br></li></ul>language (SQL) and SDLC concepts<br><ul><li> Strong organization and communication skills.<br><br></li></ul>Position will require task prioritization, requirement creation, presentations<br><br>to senior leadership and interaction with technical/non-technical stakeholders.<br><ul><li> Creative and proactive problem solver –<br><br></li></ul>ability to quickly grasp what the team needs and offer suggestions above and<br><br>beyond what they are asking for to determine the best available solution<br><ul><li> Basic to intermediate application of<br><br></li></ul>statistics principles to include standard deviations, deriving populations and<br><br>sampling rates, probability and distribution, and non-graphical exploratory<br><br>data analysis.<br><ul><li> Ability to coach and walk others through<br><br></li></ul>statistical processes so that they understand how solutions were derived.<br><ul><li> Willingness to work with technology teams that<br><br></li></ul>thrive on idea sharing and innovation.<br><ul><li> Previous experience in managing large data<br><br></li></ul>sets, query tools, etc.<br><ul><li> Ability to prototype ideas into workable<br><br></li></ul>solutions that will translate into long-term automation projects for the<br><br>technology teams.<br><ul><li> Must be able to work independently on a team<br><br></li></ul>that is geographically separated.<br><ul><li> Intermediate use of Microsoft Word,<br><br></li></ul>PowerPoint, and Visio<br><ul><li> Expert use of Microsoft Excel to include pivot<br><br></li></ul>tables, macros, visualizations, and queries.<br><ul><li> Track record in delivering metrics frameworks,<br><br></li></ul>executive dashboards, BI Visualization, or similar projects at the departmental<br><br>scale (100+ people) of a Fortune 500 organization.<br><br> Desired Skills <br><ul><li> Data mapping and analysis skills to include<br><br></li></ul>mapping dissimilar data structures across multiple systems of record.<br><ul><li> Requirement gathering concepts. Ability to<br><br></li></ul>work with multiple stakeholders to gather business requirements and translate<br><br>those into technical requirements.<br><ul><li> Experience with SQL, Python, and Business<br><br></li></ul>Intelligence (BI) tools<br><ul><li> Data design/development experience in Hadoop,<br><br></li></ul>JIRA, and BI Tools/analytics platforms (i.e., Arcadia, Tableau, Microstrategy,<br><br>SharePoint) preferred.<br><ul><li> Experience with MySQL database management</li><li> Experience with the Agile methodology<br><br></li></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: (Remote) Entry/ Junior Level Data Analyst
description: SYNERGISTICIT is aware that the Job Market is Challenging because of Tech Layoffs. The Job market is flooded with hundreds and thousands of laid-off Jobseekers competing with existing Jobseekers. For entry-level Job seekers to get client interviews and jobs they need to differentiate themselves by ensuring they have exceptional skills and technologies to be noticed by clients.<br>Since 2010 we have helped Jobseekers differentiate themselves by providing clients with candidates who have the requisite skills and experience to outperform at interviews and clients. Here at SynergisticIT We just don't focus on getting you a Job we make careers. All Positions are open for all visas and US citizens We at Synergisticit understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped thousands of candidates get jobs at technology clients like Apple, Google, and Paypal, western union, Client, visa, Walmart labs, etc., to name a few. We have an excellent reputation with the clients. Currently, we are looking for (Remote) Entry/ Junior Level Data Analyst<br>Who Should Apply Recent Computer Science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates looking to make their careers in IT Industry We welcome candidates with all visas and citizens to apply. We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates<br>We also offer Skill enhancement programs for candidates who are either missing skills or lacking Industry/Client experience with Projects and skills. Candidates have difficulty finding jobs or cracking interviews or want to improve their skill portfolio. If they are qualified with enough skills and have hands-on project work with clients then no need for skill enhancement.<br>Candidates can benefit from skill enhancement if they fall into the below categories.<br>Candidates who Lack Experience or are fresher with No actual Job experience with projects with clients who Have had a break in careers Lack Technical Competency or skills being demanded by clients Different visa candidates (Like OPT/H4EAD/L2EAD) who want to get employed and settle down in the USA please check the below links to see success outcomes of our candidates https://www.synergisticit.com/candidate-outcomes/<br>Watch the below videos of us participating in Industry events with the Top companies in Technology at Oracle Cloud World/Oracle Java One (Las Vegas) and at Gartner Data Analytics Summit (Florida)<br>Oracle Cloud World Event (OCW) Las Vegas 2022 | SynergisticIT - YouTube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OAFOhcGy9Z8<br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EmO7NrWHkLM https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVBU9RYZ6UI<br>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yy74yvjatVg SynergisticIT at Gartner Data and Analytics Summit 2023 - YouTube<br>https://www.synergisticit.com/java-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/data-science-track/ https://www.synergisticit.com/contact-us/<br>If you have relevant skills and industry experience, please apply if not then candidates can opt for Skill enhancement.<br>For getting help with interviews please visit<br>https://www.synergisticit.com/interview-questions/<br>REQUIRED SKILLS for Java /Software Programmers<br>· Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT<br>· Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive<br>· Experience in programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle<br>· Project work on the skills<br>· Knowledge of Core Java, java script, C++ or software programming<br>· Spring boot, Micro-services, Docker, Jenkins and REST API's experience<br>· Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br>For data Science/Machine learning<br>REQUIRED SKILLS<br>· Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT<br>· Project work on the technologies needed<br>· Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive<br>· Experience in the programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle<br>· Knowledge of Statistics, SAS, Python, Computer Vision, and data visualization tools<br>· Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br>Preferred skills: NLP, Text mining, Tableau, Power BI, Time series analysis<br>Please understand skills and relevant experience on real-world projects are required by clients for selection even if it's a Junior or entry-level position the additional skills and Project work with hands-on experience building projects at the client site are the only way a candidate can be picked by clients. If not having the skills or hands-on project work at the client site, candidates can opt for skill enhancement to gain the required skills and project work. No third-party candidates or c2c candidates<br>please only apply to the posting

title: Data Analyst - Supply Chain
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Our client, a leading provider of equipment and services for the global automotive industry, is looking to hire a <strong>Data Analyst - Supply Chain </strong>for their office in the southwest suburbs of Chicago. They offer a beautiful office space and pride themselves on offering strong professional growth and great work/life balance.<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst - Supply Chain Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyze procurement and vendor data using PowerBI or Tableau </li><li> Work with cross-functional teams and senior leaders on driving insights and decisions from data </li><li> Manage vendor selection process </li><li> Support the procurement team </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Data Analyst - Supply Chain Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Excellent communicator </li><li> 1+ year of Epicor or other ERP system </li><li> Must bring experience with Tableau or Power BI analytics tool </li><li> Experience in purchasing is a plus </li><li> Bachelor's degree preferred </li></ul><p><br></p>If interested in this <strong>Data Analyst - Supply Chain</strong> position and qualify per the above requirements, please apply today!<p><br></p>Thank you,<p><br></p>Imaan Khan<p><br></p>Project Manager<p><br></p>LaSalle Network<p><br></p>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<p><br></p>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<p><br></p>

title: IT Analyst, BI and Data Modeling
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&amp;H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Overview</u></strong><p><br></p>We have a newly created opportunity for an IT Analyst, BI and Data Modeling to join our global IT team. This position can be based at our office in Milwaukee, WI or Chicago, IL (near O’Hare). We offer a hybrid work schedule (minimum 2+ days per week working in the Milwaukee or Chicago office for collaboration, team meetings, working sessions, etc. and up to 3 days per work can be telecommuting from your home office). In this role you will be responsible for analyzing datasets, designing efficient data models, and creating actionable insights to drive business value.<p><br></p><strong><strong>Key Job Responsibilities</strong></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders and leadership to gather requirements, develop, and support data modeling and BI solutions for organizational stakeholders.</li><li>Integrate disparate data sources into a cohesive data fabric, ensuring data consistency, accuracy, and reliability</li><li>Conduct business analysis activities to understand business user requirements and translate data and information flows within business processes.</li><li>Analyze process optimization opportunities and provide data-driven recommendations to drive value. </li><li>Perform data profiling, validation, and cleansing to ensure accuracy, completeness, and quality of enterprise data.</li><li>Develop and maintain a centralized data catalog, including comprehensive documentation of data models, data dictionaries, and data lineage.</li><li>Maintain data quality standards and enforce data governance policies, standards, and best practices.</li><li>Develop and monitor data pipeline and semantic layer development, permissions, maintenance, and performance. </li><li>Contribute and maintain documentation to translate the design, development, and purpose of data orchestrations for usability. </li><li>Continuously demonstrate qualitative and quantitative value and benefits contributive of enhanced data modeling and governance.</li><li>Continuously evaluate the enterprise data landscape and identify integration and AI/ML opportunities across data sets to create value. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications/Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree Required desired emphasis in IS, IT, professional certification beneficial</li><li>3+ years of experience in data modeling, data integration, data management in Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain industry.</li><li>Strong knowledge of relational, dimensional, and object-oriented data modeling techniques.</li><li>Exceptional business analysis skills, with the ability to translate complex business requirements into technical specifications and data architectures.</li><li>Technical proficiency in SQL, Python, PySpark, Spark </li><li>Expertise in data integration processes, including ETL and API management </li><li>Well versed in technology innovation advancements, including AI and ML capabilities</li><li>Ability to transform strategic discussions into concrete, actionable work plans</li><li>Ability to establish, build and maintain strong relationships with individuals at all levels of the organization</li><li>Must be able to apply the seven principles of the KOMATSU Way to their everyday work activities where applicable</li><li>Proven ability to create and build positive and productive relationships internally with employees and externally with clients and stakeholders</li><li> Excellent written, oral communication, project management and presentation skills, and the ability to present complex data and statistics in a simple and clear way </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><strong>Additional Information</strong></strong><p><br></p>Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Digital Data Specialist
description: <strong>CLIENT:</strong> a leading global provider of innovative protective packaging materials and systems.<br><br><strong>JOB TITLE:</strong> Digital Data Specialist<br><br><strong>LOCATION:</strong> fully remote.<br><br><strong>ROLE TYPE/DURATION</strong>: through end of year w/ potential to extend.<br><br><strong>HOURLY RATE: </strong>$30-$38/hr<br><br>The Digital Data Specialist will lead product catalog content management for the company’s customer portal site. In this role you will be taking product data that is in SAP, identifying what catalog is relevant, curating marketing description, matching the information up in Excel (working within pivot tables), and then handling the workflow into product categories. This individual will act as the liaison between product management, data, and brand marketing teams. Responsibilities include managing the day-to-day maintenance, deploying new catalog versions, enriching product content, validating data accuracy, and proposing improvements as needed to drive adoption and conversion.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities: <br></strong><ul><li>Responsible for store management on connect.pregis.com, including product info accuracy, product catalog content, catalog navigation, and featured product advertising. </li><li>Utilize digital analytics to identify digital experience improvements to increase adoption and conversion. </li><li>Partner with product and master data teams to ensure product content is accurate, engaging and recommend continuous improvements. </li><li>Partner with marketing teams to manage product information management (PIM) system. </li><li>Responsible for enriched product content and asset management related to products shown within the digital commerce experience. </li><li>Master the ability to deploy catalog versions to serve multiple customer segments/channels to market. </li><li>Work in collaboration with the digital commerce product owner to identify, prioritize and deliver roadmap. </li><li>Build and optimize the stakeholder journey throughout the site to meet the ability to find products and critical information to improve customer retention. </li><li>Responsible for onsite taxonomy strategy and planning, collaborating with the master data team to understand how it fits into overall taxonomy plans and implementing within brand/product hierarchy</li><li>Work with the marketing team to plan for new product launches and promotions; integrate plans into backlog and website launch plans as needed. </li><li>Create a culture of testing and experimentation to innovate on how we drive business growth, acquisition, user engagement, churn reductions. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree required</li><li>3+ years’ experience in product merchandising or category management</li><li>Skilled in working within Excel (pivot tables), CMS management platforms. (SAP Commerce)</li><li>Graphic / image editing software and HTML experience desired. </li><li>Have a commercially strong mindset and be very connected to business stakeholders. </li><li>Detail oriented approach to data management and timeline management</li><li>Able to build strong relationships with a wide range of people. This person works cooperatively across the business and puts the good of the business above their own career interests. </li><li>Strong communication skills: this person is able to present information (both written and oral) clearly and concisely</li><li>Adaptable, be open to taking on more and have the ability to adapt plans and direction as the business indicates</li><li>Proven expertise in problem solving and multiple project management. <br><br></li></ul>At WunderLand we’re zealous about helping our customers increase customer reach, engagement, advocacy, and brand loyalty through digital, creative, marketing and communications channels. WunderLand’s mission is to be the go-to partner for digital, creative, and sales enablement services, and a premier employer for creative and digital specialists. It is WunderLand Group’s practice not to discriminate against any employee or applicant because of sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or sexual preference, pregnancy or maternity, genetic information, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law. If you have a disability or handicap and would like us to accommodate you in any reasonable way, please inform your recruiter so that we can discuss the appropriate alternatives available. WunderLand Group is part of the Advanced Group, a talent acquisition and management, consulting, outsourcing, and professional services organization.<br><br>

title: Report Developer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Our client in the nonprofit sector is seeking a skilled and enthusiastic Crystal Reports Developer.. As a Crystal Reports Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining Crystal Reports to support our organization's reporting needs. Your proficiency in Crystal Reports, SQL, and data visualization will be essential in providing accurate and insightful reports for informed decision-making. This will be a short term part time contract position.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Crystal Reports Development: Design, develop, and maintain Crystal Reports to fulfill the reporting requirements of various departments within the organization. Create visually appealing and user-friendly reports that effectively present data.</li><li>SQL Database Expertise: Possess a strong understanding of SQL and demonstrate proficiency in writing SQL queries, optimizing database performance, and working with data from various sources. Ability to construct complex queries and manipulate data to extract meaningful insights for reporting purposes.</li><li>Data Visualization: Utilize Crystal Reports to create visually engaging reports that effectively communicate complex information to stakeholders. Use charts, graphs, and other data visualization techniques to present data in a clear and understandable manner.</li><li>Vues &amp; Tables in SQL: Experience working with Vues and Tables in SQL to extract, transform, and analyze data. Ability to utilize Vues and Tables to create dynamic and interactive reports.</li><li>Communication Skills: Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Collaborate effectively with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and translate them into actionable reports. Communicate technical concepts and findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical staff.</li><li>Report Optimization: Continuously improve the performance and efficiency of existing Crystal Reports. Identify and address any issues or bottlenecks related to data extraction, processing, or presentation.</li><li>Database Management: Collaborate with the IT team to ensure the availability and integrity of data sources used for reporting purposes. Assist in database design and optimization efforts to enhance reporting capabilities.</li><li>Quality Assurance: Conduct thorough testing of Crystal Reports to ensure accuracy, data integrity, and adherence to business requirements. Address any issues or bugs promptly and work towards solutions in collaboration with relevant stakeholders.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Proven experience as a Crystal Reports Developer or similar role.</li><li>Proficiency in Crystal Reports, SQL, and data visualization techniques.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Vues and Tables in SQL.</li><li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.</li><li>Prior experience working with non-profit organizations is a plus.<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer wanted by Egencia LLC in Chicago, IL. Writing code utilizing Python, Java, Spark, and SQL; Working with data and delivering good-quality code; Fostering and strengthening a deep understanding of vast data sources in the cloud and know precisely how, when, and which data to use to solve particular business problems; Designing, architecting, implementing and supporting critical streams and datasets that support our business, clients, and data scientists; Being responsible for end-to-end data solution design and implementation, including data modeling, pipelining, transformation, and visualization; Implementing product features, working with Product Owners, data operations teams, and other data engineers; and being responsible for implementing best practices like infrastructure as code, automated testing, code reviews.<p><br></p>Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field plus five (5) years of experience in any occupation which includes the required experience/skills. Must also five (5) years of experience with Python; five (5) years of experience using Kafka; five (5) years of experience using AWS cloud technologies such as EMR, Lambda, EC2, and data pipelines; five (5) years of experience leading data warehousing and analytics projects, including using cloud technologies such as EMR, Kinesis, Lambda and EC2; five (5) years of experience with Agile, DevOps, CICD frameworks in cloud-based environments; five (5) years of experience developing dashboards using Tableau; and five (5) years of experience with development in relational database applications. Salary range $122,470-$184,000.<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong><p><br></p>United States - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p>It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.<p><br></p>GBT Recruitment Privacy Statement

title: Data Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer:</strong> DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> <strong>Data Engineer (</strong>multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining complex data solutions for the product. Mentor and influence peers to achieve commitments on data solutions on time and with quality. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong> Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or a related field, and 36 months of experience in Sr. Associate - Projects or related.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills:</strong> Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: implementing cloud-based solutions and using Amazon Web Service (AWS) knowledge to provide cloud solutions in platform strategies; creating AWS serverless solutions for data conversion and unstructured data transfers; analyzing complex infrastructure data granularities, data visualization, iterative prototyping, and analysis tools to define architecture and develop high performance cloud-based solutions; working with large-scale data transformation and data modernization; and analyzing requirements and creating technical designs.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at </em><em>MyDiscoverBenefits.com</em>.<p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls.  Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Database Engineer
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>A self-motivated individual responsible for database object design, development, maintenance for the enterprise application data model and database administration both on-premise and in the Azure Cloud. Ensures enterprise database procedures, methodologies and standards are maintained across the application teams. Performs database promotions to all servers per Service Level Agreements. Provides necessary production problem resolution to support departmental server up time goals. Assists with SQL Server upgrades to the Enterprise.<br><br>This is a Hybrid position- requires time in our Oakbrook Terrace, IL central office. Typically,1- 2 days per week and as needed..<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Provides login and security maintenance. </li><li> Monitors database performance. </li><li> Supports and provides tables, constraints, and triggers in a timely manner to several application development teams in a multi-tasking environment. </li><li> Reviews stored procedures and ensures that The Joint Commission database standards, guidelines, proper naming conventions and T-SQL coding techniques for optimal performance are enforced. </li><li> Creates logical and physical data model diagrams using 3 rd party tools. </li><li> Rotates on-call 24/7 production support. </li><li> Provides nonproduction and production promotions in a timely fashion according to SLA. </li><li> Monitors database integrity in a proactive manner. </li><li> Performs SQL Server installs and upgrades. </li><li> Supports the Disaster Recovery tests under supervision. </li><li> Performs other duties as requested by the team and business. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Three to five years’ experience in relational database systems. </li><li> Experience with implementing SSIS / SSRS. </li><li> BS, BA degree in computer science or equivalent experience. </li><li> Lean / Six Sigma Yellow Belt </li><li> Microsoft Certified Azure Data Fundamentals is a plus. </li><li> Knowledge of a scripting language, preferably PowerShell or JSON or Python. </li><li> Demonstrated knowledge of relational database concepts and modeling, with a high technical aptitude in database management. </li><li> Experience in the use of SQL and T-SQL for query and transaction processing. </li><li> Working knowledge of a programming environment (i.e. .Net Framework, Entity Framework). </li><li> Excellent oral and written communication skills. </li><li> Excellent troubleshooting and performance tuning skills. </li><li> Ability to use Profiler and DMV. </li><li> Experience with data modeling tools. </li><li> 1-2 years’ experience with SQL Azure or any other cloud database platform. <br></li></ul><strong> Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. <br><br></strong>This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.
description_json: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>A self-motivated individual responsible for database object design, development, maintenance for the enterprise application data model and database administration both on-premise and in the Azure Cloud. Ensures enterprise database procedures, methodologies and standards are maintained across the application teams. Performs database promotions to all servers per Service Level Agreements. Provides necessary production problem resolution to support departmental server up time goals. Assists with SQL Server upgrades to the Enterprise.<br><br>This is a Hybrid position- requires time in our Oakbrook Terrace, IL central office. Typically,1- 2 days per week and as needed..<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Provides login and security maintenance. </li><li> Monitors database performance. </li><li> Supports and provides tables, constraints, and triggers in a timely manner to several application development teams in a multi-tasking environment. </li><li> Reviews stored procedures and ensures that The Joint Commission database standards, guidelines, proper naming conventions and T-SQL coding techniques for optimal performance are enforced. </li><li> Creates logical and physical data model diagrams using 3 rd party tools. </li><li> Rotates on-call 24/7 production support. </li><li> Provides nonproduction and production promotions in a timely fashion according to SLA. </li><li> Monitors database integrity in a proactive manner. </li><li> Performs SQL Server installs and upgrades. </li><li> Supports the Disaster Recovery tests under supervision. </li><li> Performs other duties as requested by the team and business. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> Three to five years’ experience in relational database systems. </li><li> Experience with implementing SSIS / SSRS. </li><li> BS, BA degree in computer science or equivalent experience. </li><li> Lean / Six Sigma Yellow Belt </li><li> Microsoft Certified Azure Data Fundamentals is a plus. title: SQL Server Database Developer - Remote | WFH
description: Are you passionate about data analysis and developing database solutions that drive key operational decisions? We have an amazing opportunity for a skilled and enthusiastic Database Developer at our dynamic organization! Join us at UPG, a leading company in [industry/field], and make a significant impact on our data-driven decision-making process.<br><br>As a Database Developer, you will be responsible for analyzing, interpreting data, and developing robust database objects that empower our organization to make informed decisions. Collaborating closely with project managers and technical leads, both technical and non-technical, you will tackle complex business questions and provide valuable insights. Reporting to our Data Services Manager, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data infrastructure and enhancing our overall efficiency.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Duties And Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Dive deep into data, utilizing statistical methodology to collect, interpret, and analyze information.<br><br>Create efficient stored procedures and queries across multiple data sources, delivering accurate and timely results.<br><br>Identify and interpret trends and patterns within complex data sets, uncovering invaluable insights.<br><br>Collaborate closely with business leaders and end users, providing the necessary support and addressing their data analysis requirements.<br><br>Troubleshoot and resolve data-related bugs and issues, ensuring seamless database operations.<br><br><strong><u>Position Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field, showcasing your strong foundation.<br><br>Extensive experience (5+ years) in T-SQL, including queries, stored procedures, triggers, functions, views, tables, constraints, etc. SQL server administration expertise is a must.<br><br>Proven track record (5+ years) of relevant data analysis work experience, demonstrating your deep understanding of data-driven decision-making.<br><br>Strong proficiency (3+ years) in Database Design and SQL server performance tuning, optimizing database performance.<br><br>Familiarity (1+ years) with Python, enabling you to leverage its power in database development.<br><br>Exceptional troubleshooting skills to swiftly identify and resolve data-related issues.<br><br>Proficiency in MS Excel, leveraging its capabilities to analyze and present data effectively.<br><br>Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills, enabling seamless collaboration with stakeholders.<br><br>Strong analytical skills with an unwavering attention to detail and accuracy, ensuring reliable data outcomes.<br><br>Must reside in the IL area, allowing for smooth coordination and collaboration.<br><br><strong><u>Incentives<br><br></u></strong>Enjoy an annual bonus, recognizing your valuable contributions to our success!<br><br>Embrace a hybrid schedule (3 days in-office, 2 days remote) in our corporate office located in Oak Brook, IL, offering flexibility and work-life balance.<br><br><strong><u>Diversity &amp; Inclusion Statement<br><br></u></strong>At UPG Enterprises LLC and its Affiliates, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, offering equal opportunities for all individuals to thrive and succeed.<br><br>Join our passionate team of professionals, unleash your potential, and be part of an exciting journey where your expertise in SQL Server database development will make a difference. Apply today and let's embark on this thrilling career opportunity together!<br><br>Employment Type: Full-Time<br><br>Salary: $ 69,000.00 116,000.00 Per Year

title: Data Engineer II, Data Infrastructure
description: <em>At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us.</em><p><br></p><em>The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees’ personal and professional lives.</em><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary:</strong><p><br></p>The Data Engineer II manages and develops data processes to cleanse, transform, load, and/or export data to/from the data warehouse, to support commercial teams.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Utilizes the Microsoft SQL Server database software to manage and house data from multiple sources</li><li>Assists in the designing of data structures that can support large amounts of data, are easy to use, and processes efficiently; implements creation of data structures</li><li>Designs, creates, and QCs ETL (Extract Transform Load) processes via SQL Server’s SSIS functionality, Databricks, Azure Data Factory and Python</li><li>Incorporates robust data validation, cleansing, and management methodologies</li><li>Builds processes with a strong focus on automation and repeatable processes</li><li>Documents processes and associated business logic</li><li>Executes simple and complex queries to pull data to support and/or answer adhoc questions</li><li>Works with manager(s) to project plan, establish timelines, and map out associated tasks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong><ul><li>BA/BS required</li><li>5+ years of experience in a similar role</li><li>Experience in the pharmaceutical industry or technology consulting, including experience in Database Architecture and/or Software Development preferred</li><li>Proficient in all components of SQL Server:</li><ul><li>Transact-SQL</li><li>Tables, keys, and indices</li><li>Stored Procedures, Functions, and Views</li></ul><li>Experience with Python</li><li>Experience with cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP)</li><li>Strong documentation and quality assurance skills</li><li>Proficient in Microsoft Office.</li><li>Professional, proactive demeanor.</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.</em>

title: Test Jie
description: Enterprise is a national nonprofit that exists to make a good home possible for the millions of families without one. We support community development organizations on the ground, aggregate and invest capital for impact, advance housing policy at every level of government, and build and manage communities ourselves. Since 1982, we have invested $54 billion and created 873,000 homes across all 50 states – all to make home and community places of pride, power and belonging.<p><br></p>Join us at enterprisecommunity.org.<p><br></p><strong>Working at Enterprise </strong><p><br></p>At Enterprise, you’ll be part of a diverse, committed team making a difference every day. You will collaborate with some of the smartest minds and biggest hearts in our field. You’ll be empowered to drive systems change and take bold steps to advance racial equity. And you will find a career home where you’re valued and supported in your growth journey.<p><br></p>Enterprise offers career opportunities in our offices across the country with an exceptional benefits package.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Advisors is a mission-based consultancy department within Enterprise focused on delivering capacity building and technical assistance in partnership with Federal agencies, units of local government, public housing authorities, nonprofit organizations, philanthropy, and others. We work with partners to improve the capacity, outcomes and impacts of community development and housing programs and organizations nationwide so that all people have a place to live, grow and thrive. We seek to advance racial equity and dismantle the enduring legacy of systemic racism in housing both through and within the work we do.<p><br></p><strong><u>The ERR Team Helps Local Governments In Underestimated Cities Tap Their Strengths And Unlock Their Potential By Connecting With</u></strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a dynamic Program Associate to join our Equitable Resilience &amp; Revitalization (ERR) team of Enterprise Advisors. For a variety of reasons—from racist policies like redlining to macroeconomic shifts leading to the loss of major industries and employers—there are cities and neighborhoods across the country that have suffered from disinvestment, fiscal distress, population and job loss, vacant and deteriorated residential and commercial properties, high poverty and unemployment rates, and increased risk and vulnerability to climate hazards and environmental stressors. At the same time, the local governments and cross-sector and community partners in these cities and neighborhoods have strengths to tap and potential to unlock—and they have been underestimated. There are stories and lessons of success from within their own communities and across the country, of local governments and their cross-sector and community partners revitalizing their cities and neighborhoods. There are resources at the state and federal level and from the private and philanthropic sectors that can be leveraged to grow local strength. What is needed is connection.<p><br></p><ul><li> their local cross-sector and community partners</li><li> the stories and lessons from successful equitable recovery and revitalization from within their community and around the country</li><li> the needed resources at the local, state, and federal level and from the private and philanthropic sectors</li></ul><p><br></p>The Program Associate will be an integral member of the ERR team and involved in all aspects of the work from managing our project pipeline to implementing projects. They will also have the opportunity to work on projects led by other Enterprise Advisors teams and other parts of Enterprise where there is a need and an alignment with their interests and expertise. The Program Associate will report to the Director for Equitable Resilience and Revitalization.<p><br></p>This position may be based in any of the following locations: Washington, DC; Boston, MA; Atlanta, GA; Cleveland, OH; New Orleans, LA; Chicago, IL; Detroit, MI; New York. Candidates based in Washington, DC are preferred.<p><br></p>Salary Range: $60,000-$70,000<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong><strong>Job Description</strong></strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Serve as primary researcher and data analyst on projects, which may include reviewing reports, studies, articles, policies, and other written documents; collecting, analyzing, and mapping data; and conducting interviews and focus groups with clients and project stakeholders</li><li>Support the development of project deliverables, such as reports, presentations, etc., which may include producing written or graphic design content</li><li>Assist with meeting coordination and management</li><li>Support project management and administration, including budgeting, recordkeeping, and other operational duties as needed</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>An undergraduate degree in real estate, housing and community development, planning, policy, or a related field. A graduate degree is preferred</li><li>Experience conducting research—primary and secondary; quantitative and qualitative—is required</li><li>Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to work on multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously</li><li>Ability to travel to out-of-town work sites is required</li><li>Experience working in or closely with municipal government is desirable</li><li>Graphic design skills are desirable</li><li>GIS mapping skills are desirable</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills combined with the ability to translate complex information for non-technical audiences</li><li>Willingness to ask questions combined with a curiosity and commitment to learn and apply new skills, approaches, and knowledge</li><li>Comfort and experience working with and for diverse staff, clients, and communities at a variety of scales, including neighborhoods, small/rural towns, or cities is preferred</li><li>Demonstrated commitment to racial equity</li></ul><p><br></p>To ensure a diverse and inclusive candidate pool, we encourage you to consider applying even if you do not meet every qualification listed, especially those described as preferable and desirable not required.
description_json: Enterprise is a national nonprofit that exists to make a good home possible for the millions of families without one. We support community development organizations on the ground, aggregate and invest capital for impact, advance housing policy at every level of government, and build and manage communities ourselves. Since 1982, we have invested $54 billion and created 873,000 homes across all 50 states – all to make home and community places of pride, power and belonging.<p><br></p>Join us at enterprisecommunity.org.<p><br></p><strong>Working at Enterprise </strong><p><br></p>At Enterprise, you’ll be part of a diverse, committed team making a difference every day. You will collaborate with some of the smartest minds and biggest hearts in our field. You’ll be empowered to drive systems change and take bold steps to advance racial equity. And you will find a career home where you’re valued and supported in your growth journey.<p><br></p>Enterprise offers career opportunities in our offices across the country with an exceptional benefits package.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>Advisors is a mission-based consultancy department within Enterprise focused on delivering capacity building and technical assistance in partnership with Federal agencies, units of local government, public housing authorities, nonprofit organizations, philanthropy, and others. We work with partners to improve the capacity, outcomes and impacts of community development and housing programs and organizations nationwide so that all people have a place to live, grow and thrive. We seek to advance racial equity and dismantle the enduring legacy of systemic racism in housing both through and within the work we do.<p><br></p><strong><u>The ERR Team Helps Local Governments In Underestimated Cities Tap Their Strengths And Unlock Their Potential By Connecting With</u></strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a dynamic Program Associate to join our Equitable Resilience &amp; Revitalization (ERR) team of Enterprise Advisors. For a variety of reasons—from racist policies like redlining to macroeconomic shifts leading to the loss of major industries and employers—there are cities and neighborhoods across the country that have suffered from disinvestment, fiscal distress, population and job loss, vacant and deteriorated residential and commercial properties, high poverty and unemployment rates, and increased risk and vulnerability to climate hazards and environmental stressors. At the same time, the local governments and cross-sector and community partners in these cities and neighborhoods have strengths to tap and potential to unlock—and they have been underestimated. There are stories and lessons of success from within their own communities and across the country, of local governments and their cross-sector and community partners revitalizing their cities and neighborhoods. There are resources at the state and federal level and from the private and philanthropic sectors that can be leveraged to grow local strength. What is needed is connection.<p><br></p><ul><li> their local cross-sector and community partners</li><li> the stories and lessons from successful equitable recovery and revitalization from within their community and around the country</li><li> the needed resources at the local, state, and federal level and from the private and philanthropic sectors</li></ul><p><br></p>The Program Associate will be an integral member of the ERR team and involved in all aspects of the work from managing our project pipeline to implementing projects. They will also have the opportunity to work on projects led by other Enterprise Advisors teams and other parts of Enterprise where there is a need and an alignment with their interests and expertise. The Program Associate will report to the Director for Equitable Resilience and Revitalization.<p><br></p>This position may be based in any of the following locations: Washington, DC; Boston, MA; Atlanta, GA; Cleveland, OH; New Orleans, LA; Chicago, IL; Detroit, MI; New York. Candidates based in Washington, DC are preferred.<p><br></p>Salary Range: $60,000-$70,000<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><u><strong><strong>Job Description</strong></strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Serve as primary researcher and data analyst on projects, which may include reviewing reports, studies, articles, policies, and other written documents; collecting, analyzing, and mapping data; and conducting interviews and focus groups with clients and project stakeholders</li><li>Support the development of project deliverables, such as reports, presentations, etc., which may include producing written or graphic design content</li><li>Assist with meeting coordination and management</li><li>Support project management and administration, including budgeting, recordkeeping, and other operational duties as needed</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>An undergraduate degree in real estate, housing and community development, planning, policy, or a related field. A graduate degree is preferred</li><li>Experience conducting research—primary and secondary; quantitative and qualitative—is required</li><li>Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to work on multiple time-sensitive projects simultaneously</li><li>Ability to travel to out-of-town work sites is required</li><li>Experience working in or closely with municipal government is desirable</li><li>Graphic design skills are desirable</li><li>GIS mapping skills are desirable</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills combined with the ability to translate complex information for non-technical audiences</li><li>Willingness to ask questions combined with a curiosity and commitment to learn and apply new skills, approaches, and knowledge</li><li>Comfort and experience working with and for diverse staff, clients, and communities at a variety of scales, including neighborhoods, small/rural towns, or cities is preferred</li><li>Demonstrated commitment to racial equity</li></ul><p><br></p>To ensure a diverse and inclusive candidate pool, we encourage you to consider applying even if you do not meet every qualification listed, especially those described as preferable and desirable not required.

title: Program Associate
description: <strong>Location<br><br></strong>Westchester <strong>Job Category<br><br></strong>Information Technology <strong>Full-Time/Part-Time<br><br></strong>Full-time <strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent.</li><li>3+ years of experience designing and implementing end-to-end data analytics solutions.</li><li>Experience designing and implementing semantic layers for Business Intelligence and Analytics consumption.</li><li>Experience developing actionable reports and dashboards, experience in Power BI or Tableau a plus.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex data sets or business requirements and translate them into tangible solutions.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with business stakeholders and technical teams.</li><li>Experience in project management and Agile methodologies.</li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.</li><li>Strong understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines and experience working with them is a plus.</li><li>Experience with cloud computing platforms, such as Azure and Google Cloud Platform.</li><li>Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, and Cloud certifications are a plus.</li><li>Experience working in the retail and education industries is a plus.<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>Position Overview<br><br></strong>Join the Follett Team, where employees are valued, respected, and offered career paths throughout its many campus locations.<br><br>Follett serves over half of the students in the United States and works with 80,000 schools as a leading provider of education technology, services, print, and digital content. We're higher education's largest campus retailer and a hub for school spirit and community as we operate nearly 1,200 local campus stores and over 1,600 virtual stores across the continent. We take pride in the fact that for more than 140 years, we have been helping to improve people's lives by supporting a lifetime of learning and education.<br><br>We are looking for a results-driven <strong>Business Intelligence Engineer</strong> to join the Follett team.<br><br>The Business Intelligence Engineer is responsible for designing and implementing data analytics solutions that enable the organization to make data-driven decisions. This role works closely with enterprise stakeholders to identify requirements and then designs solutions that meet their needs.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Develop and implement end-to-end scalable and maintainable BI solutions.</li><li>Develop data dictionaries, mapping, functional design, and other technical documentation.</li><li>Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including business users and IT leadership; to understand their requirements and design solutions that meet their needs.</li><li>Perform data analysis and profiling to identify data quality issues and work with data owners to resolve them.</li><li>Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies and evaluate their potential use in the organization.<br><br><br></li></ul>

title: *100% Remote* Microsoft Engineer
description: Lever builds software for teams to source, interview, and hire top talent. Our team strives to set a new bar for enterprise software with modern, well-designed, real-time apps. We participated in Y Combinator in summer 2012, and since then have raised $33 million. This year, we're doubling the team in size, and we're looking forward to supporting more great companies like Netflix, Eventbrite, and Lyft.<br><br>Under the hood, we're a technology company with a powerful open-source web framework: DerbyJS. It is the first and only open-source MVC framework that syncs all data via an Operational Transformation backend, using the same algorithm that powers Google Docs. DerbyJS is also uniquely optimized to render everything on the server as well as the client.Lever is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

title: Data Center Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with the following tools: AppDynamics, Datadog, New Relic and Insta</li><li>Application development experience, Kubernetes knowledge</li><li>Experience administering Infrastructure tools as well as installations.</li><li>Hands-on experience with UNIX and or/SQL</li><li>Experience in scripting and automation tools such as Python, PowerShell or Bash</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment.</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>The scope of the Infrastructure Engineer role includes building, managing, and supporting core infrastructure and security services in public cloud to deliver highly available and scalable services, and meet security and compliance objectives. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining complex workflows using Unica software. You will support Infrastructure maintenance activities - Patching, Decomm, Filesystems and other infra related activity including the application upgrade and the performance of the application.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Collaborates with business partners to design, build and code cross-channel communications using campaign platforms such as Unica Campaign.</li><li>Responsible for administration of UNICA Campaign and UNICA Marketing Operations</li><li>This will also include providing UNICA platform security management, application and underlying infrastructure support (OS, Storage, Application, Web and Database).</li><li>Translates and conveys business solutions and strategies into system and database architecture.</li><li>Designs and builds strategies, processes, and technology solutions that support business needs and align with industry best practices.</li><li>Ability to create and translate complex SQL queries to support ad-hoc business requests.</li><li>Identifies data solutions to support complex campaigns including SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, flat files, and data warehouses.</li><li>Develops and maintains best practices and standard operating procedures for campaigns.</li><li>Serves as the primary liaison to technology partners for issue escalation, and resolution.</li><li>Troubleshooting technical issues and providing technical support to Business partners</li><li>Maintaining and updating the workflow automation environment to ensure description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>The scope of the Infrastructure Engineer role includes building, managing, and supporting core infrastructure and security services in public cloud to deliver highly available and scalable services, and meet security and compliance objectives. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining complex workflows using Unica software. You will support Infrastructure maintenance activities - Patching, Decomm, Filesystems and other infra related activity including the application upgrade and the performance of the application.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Collaborates with business partners to design, build and code cross-channel communications using campaign platforms such as Unica Campaign.</li><li>Responsible for administration of UNICA Campaign and UNICA Marketing Operations</li><li>This will also include providing UNICA platform database architecture.</li><li>Designs and builds strategies, processes, and technology solutions that support business needs and align with industry best practices.</li><li>Ability to create and translate complex SQL queries to support ad-hoc business requests.</li><li>Identifies data solutions to support complex campaigns including SQL Server, Oracle, Teradata, flat files, and data warehouses.</li><li>Develops and maintains best practices and standard operating procedures for campaigns.</li><li>Serves as the primary liaison to technology partners for issue escalation, and resolution.</li><li>Troubleshooting technical issues and providing technical support to Business partners</li><li>Maintaining and updating the workflow automation environment to ensure optimization.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SQL competency, Linux Command Line competency</li><li>System Architecture experience</li><li>Experience working with Unica Campaign Management platforms.</li><li>UNICA campaign management product expertise – Administrative</li><li>Unica flowcharts experience</li><li>Experience with ETL Tools (Ab Initio, Data Stage, Informatica)</li><li>Experience in programming languages (Unix scripting, Python, Java, etc…)</li><li>Proficient in UNIX, and Linux</li><li>Proficiency in Scripting (Batch/Shell/Java Script).</li><li>Linux korn shell scripting knowledge </li><li>Websphere knowledge </li><li>SSH, SAS experience, SFTP
