title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Enjoy problem-solving, need a venue to display your creativity, and emerging technologies pique your interest; if so, Barrow Wise Consulting, LLC is for you. As a multi-disciplined leader, you understand the gifts that set you apart from everyone else. Demonstrate innovative solutions to our clients. Join Barrow Wise Consulting, LLC today.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>The Identity Management Engineer will support Barrow Wise's Chicago Board of Education project and perform the following duties:<p><br></p><ul><li>Determine the architecture and set the overall direction for the district's identity management and collaboration services</li><li>Help define the architecture and detailed designs per industry best practices for SSO, multi-factor authentication, Identity Management, and other access management-related solutions</li><li>Demonstrate advanced knowledge of Identity Management and Active Directory</li><li>Demonstrate experience with Identity Automation's RapidIdentity suite of products, including end-to-end development of Action Sets in RapidConnect for identity provisioning and data movement between disparate systems and development of SAML 2.0 integrations in RapidAppliance.</li><li>Exhibit excellent communication skills for interaction with all levels within the organization to determine requirements and propose and implement solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>An Ideal Candidate Has The Following</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>U.S. Citizenship</li><li>Education: Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or related field</li><li>Preferred: Professional certifications demonstrating expertise</li><li>Ten (10) years of experience required</li></ul><p><br></p>Join the team at Barrow Wise Consulting, LLC for a fulfilling and engaging experience! Our team is dedicated to providing innovative solutions to our clients in an ethical and diverse work environment. We offer competitive compensation packages, excellent benefits, and opportunities for growth and advancement. Barrow Wise is an equal opportunity, drug-free employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran/LBGT are welcome to apply.<p><br></p>Our employees stand behind Barrow Wise's core values of integrity, quality, innovation, and diversity. We are confident that Barrow Wise's core values, business model, and team focus create positive career paths for our employees. Barrow Wise will continue to lead the industry in delivering new solutions to clients and persevere until the client is overjoyed.<p><br></p><strong><em>Job Posted by ApplicantPro</em></strong>

title: Urgent job role "Python Developer"
description: Location: Chicago (Hybrid)<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> The Hybrid Cloud Services Engineer will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:</li><li> Assist in the design, build, management and operation of the infrastructure as a service layer (hosted and cloud-based platforms) that supports the different platform services.</li><li> Implementation of various cloud services according to business demand</li><li> Ensuring and defining compliance and security rules for a safe cloud infrastructure</li><li> Interconnect modern cloud services with on premise resources.</li><li> Coordinate and configure IT infrastructure services needed to provide comprehensive platform services for web applications to the business.</li><li> Design templates to assure standardized cloud infrastructure.</li><li> Interact with colleagues from other IT areas to resolve cross functional and project issues.</li><li> Incident – and problem management and request fulfillment as part of second/third level support.</li><li> Proactively identify where system or process improvements can increase efficiency and customer satisfaction.</li><li> Act as technical provider manager in a mixed mode operational environment</li><li> Work with team members to receive cross-training on individual roles and responsibilities.</li><li> Manage day-to-day print server provisioning, using standard tools.</li><li> Respond to and resolve alerts generated by print server monitoring tool.</li><li> Work with application teams to resolve issues as relates to print server software installation on servers managed by the Infrastructure Server Team.</li><li> Consults with third party vendors to obtain support, make recommendations, and assist customers with their requests.</li><li> Perform the initial input of print server-related assets into the server asset database.</li><li> Participate in Windows server "On-Call” rotation, which provides for an engineer to be available to deal with server emergencies on a 24x7 basis.</li></ul><p><br></p>In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Windows Server Engineer must<p><br></p><strong><u>Possess The Following Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Type of Education Preferred:<p><br></p>bachelor's degree or equivalent.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Following Certifications Are a Plus But Not Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert</li><li>Red hat Certified Specialist in OpenShift Administration</li><li>AWS SySOps Administrator</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Type Of Experience And Number Of Years</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Hands on experience in API Management, Azure Data Factory (ADF)</li><li> Strong cross functional knowledge (network, database, webservices, AI, Infrastructure)</li><li> Eager to learn and stay up to date on the fast-evolving cloud environment</li></ul><p><br></p>Database skills are a plus.<p><br></p><ul><li> Programming/scripting skills are a plus (PowerShell, python, terraforms, C#)</li><li> Comprehensive understanding of cloud delivery models: PaaS, SaaS, and IaaS.</li><li> Exposure to OpenShift Container Platform (OCP), and well versed in Kubernetes, microservices architecture and cloud architecture.</li><li> Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment processes and tools such as IDEs (Eclipse), Source Code management. (GIT/Stash), Jenkins, Maven, Nexus artifacts, etc.</li><li> 5 years or more experience of Windows Server 2008 through 2022 in a Hyper-V / System Center.</li><li> Virtual Machine Manager within an Enterprise Datacenter/Cloud Hybrid environment</li><li> Experience with Microsoft Failover Clustering, Host/OS Patching, Migrations, and Azure</li></ul><p><br></p>administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Must have good interpersonal, leadership, collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation skills and be able to manage conflict.</li><li> Must have excellent communication skills and be able to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people can understand as well as be able to explain customer needs and priorities in a way that technical people can understand.</li></ul>

title: Identity Management Engineer
description: <strong>Requires Secret Clearance<br><br></strong>Designs, develops, troubleshoots, and analyzes computer software. Reviews architecture and selects and integrates appropriate development and support tools to ensure product performance. Investigates, identifies, and resolves code issues logged internally by QA or end users. Develops and maintains documentation.<br><br><strong><u>Job Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Works with user groups to solve business problems with available technology including hardware, software, databases, and peripherals.</li><li> Develops and implements processes that enable agile teaming to maximize talent utilization across the customer organization.</li><li> In depth understanding of emerging IT technologies in order to create directorate level business processes</li><li> Partners with various stakeholder organization's to lead planning and business process improvement efforts.</li><li> Establishes needed processes, governance structures, performance metrics and reporting.</li><li> Applies expert functional knowledge and experience to significant business projects or processes.</li><li> Maintains expertise by in-depth involvement in the state-of-the-art research and technology development in the field.</li><li> Monitors and/or participates in industry user forums, working groups in area of expertise.</li><li> As needed, identifies the most qualified internal resources and/or contractor team to assist with tasks. Selects contractors, frames statements of work, and directs the work of the team to assure technical and financial milestones are met.</li><li> May lead a small team of capable technical staff members and advises/mentors developing technical staff, does not have direct management responsibility.</li><li> Coaches and mentors internal staff in associated technical areas of expertise.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's Degree in a related field; Master's Degree preferred<br><br>15+ years of experience in a technical field<br><br>Tech Stack/Tool Suite to be used include and which expertise is required<br><ul><li> React 16.11.0</li><li> Bootstrap 4.3.1</li><li> jQuery 1.12.4</li><li> Node.js 10.24.1</li><li> Yarn 1.22.5</li><li> Jest 24.9.0</li><li> Ruby 2.6.8</li><li> Rails 5.1.7</li><li> RubyGems 3.0.3.1</li><li> Rack version 2.2.3</li><li> Rspec 3.10</li><li> MySQL (Rails uses mysql2 gem v0.5.3 as adapter)</li><li> AWS commercial services - SQS, DynamoDB, SNS</li><li> REST APIs</li><li> Angular</li><li> Java</li><li> Python</li><li> Groovy</li><li> Vue v2.0</li><li> Vuetify v1.5</li><li> FeathersJS v6.1</li><li> Sequelize v5.21</li><li> Axios v0.18</li><li> Express.js v4.16</li><li> AWS RDS for PostgreSQL</li><li> AWS Simple Storage Service (S3)</li><li> Docker</li><li> AWS Lambda<br></li></ul><strong><u>Other Job Specific Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li> Process oriented, conceptually driven and possess the ability to think strategically and work collaboratively in a highly technical setting.</li><li> Demonstrated success in developing strategic goals and leading complex programs.</li><li> Experience with project development lifecycle and systems operations.</li><li> Proven ability to interact with customers, senior leadership and program managers in a highly matrixed environment.</li><li> Proven ability to develop and extend network of working level contacts to facilitate behind the scenes coordination.</li><li> Proven experience in designing, developing, and delivering executive level communication on organization transformation and business process changes. Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

Ability to prepare presentations and to present information to senior managers. * Ability to work and apply creativity in a fast paced environment.</li><li> Utilize creative problem-solving and communication--oral and written--skills, emphasizing the abilities to articulate, explain, and deliver technical concepts and issues to non-technical business leadership.</li><li> Recognized in field of expertise as an expert.<br></li></ul><strong>Certifications/Licensures<br><br></strong>Industry leading certification for technical expertise preferred<br><br>#cjpost

title: Cloud Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Web Developer candidates could find the new opportunity they've been searching for in Robert Half's new Web Developer position. In this role, it will be critical for you to possess a strong command of enterprise systems, an excellent coding skillset and the ability to think outside the box. Find out more about how you can play a pivotal role in bringing projects to life with a company in the Advertising industry. Call today! This long-term contract / temporary Web Developer opportunity is situated in Chicago, Illinois.<br><br>What you get to do every day<br><br>Drive and code solutions with a creative approachRecognize business needs and alter solutions to meet the company goalsWork with leadership and others to find the right solutionsWork with key partners to punctually deliver tested and reusable code in a quickly changing environment<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> 7+ years experience with both front-end and back-end technologies in a B2B or B2C web production environment- Strong familiarity with React.js</li><li> Vue.js experience</li><li> Comprehensive knowledge of WordPress</li><li> Command of PHP</li><li> Deep understanding of compatibility and cross-browser issues</li><li> Eagerness to take and turn mockups into various web languages</li><li> Knowledge of HTML and CSS</li><li> Working knowledge of server-side languages</li><li> Ability to develop end-to-end solutions that generate positive user experiences</li><li> Knowledge of caring for the technical needs of sites, apps and integrations with high volume traffic</li><li> Experience working with and tuning high volume mobile applications<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: Application Developer
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Northrop Grumman Space Systems designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation-related systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and related propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization, within Payload &amp; Ground Systems Division (PGSD), provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Staff Systems Engineer in either of the following 2 disciplines: (1) Systems Design or (2) Modelling &amp; Simulation.<br><br>This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location.<br><br>As a part of the SEIT team, a Systems Design engineer is exposed to the front end Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Systems Design Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Performing key systems engineering elements to meet a given program's requirements</li><li>Supporting the design and development of sensor system architectures</li><li>Performing functional analysis, timeline analysis, detailed trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications</li><li>Responsibility for close customer cooperation to ensure that requirements meet customer expectations</li><li>Providing presentations to customers and senior management, with tailored material based on the audience</li><li>Leading / overseeing technical work products developed by the larger engineering team, supporting design reviews and integration and test activities as needed</li><li>creating and refining Model Based System Engineering products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability and dxl script development</li><li>capability assessments to predict requirement compliance</li><li>functional algorithm development</li><li>risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li><li>generating and reporting system Technical Performance Measures</li><li>Interface development and documentation</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a Modeling &amp; Simulation Engineer is exposed to the full life-cycle of Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system is modeled with sufficient fidelity. In the early stages of programs, modeling &amp; simulation is leveraged to understand system CONOPs, inform system architecture, and perform trades. In the later stages as the design matures, field test data is used to verify and validate the models and ensure the payload models are representative of actual performance.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Modelling And Simulation Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Providing physics level and mission level modeling subject matter expertise</li><li>Leading a team of modelling and simulation engineers to define study scope and guide independent research and development activities.</li><li>Supporting capture activities, including RFI/RFP preparation, customer presentations and live demonstrations, and competitor analysis</li><li>Software development of physics-based in-house models and algorithms</li><li>Perform analysis and trades of product line architectures using analytical models and mission level simulations</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Authoring technical documentation such as white papers, proposal technical volumes, program milestone briefings (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR,...), systems engineering design documentation</li><li>Presenting technical analysis to multiple stakeholders</li><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate has recent experience in the fields of either EOIR, RF systems, or both. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialties.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas: EOIR/RF systems: sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers, lasers, LiDAR, optics, visible and IR cameras, focal plane arrays.</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul><strong> Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS degree in BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 14+ years (or MS with 12+ years, or PhD with 9+ years) related experience</li><li>Theoretical knowledge of the System Engineering V-Model and hands on experience executing the systems engineering work flow </li><li>Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving skills, and creativity</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Team players with a strong work ethic and initiative to perform in a cross functional team</li><li>Ability to obtain Top Secret/SCI level accesses</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred</li><li>Working knowledge of RF sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers </li><li>Experience with real-time signal processing in both firmware and software</li><li>Advanced knowledge of orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Knowledgeable in orbit planning in LEO, GEO and cislunar regimes</li><li>Knowledgeable in the use of COTS tools such as AGI's Systems Tool Kit (STK) and Orbital Determination Tool Kit (ODTK)</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Knowledgeable in space systems design and mission planning</li><li>Experience in specification development and requirements derivation using DOORS</li><li>Experience deploying innovative modeling methods for Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) using tools like Cameo</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel up to 15%</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $153,600 USD - $230,400 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Data Scientist Associate
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>About The Role:</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking aTechnology Operations Engineer and our Operations Team is at the intersection of trading, development, and systems administration and plays an integral part of our firms success. The team manages the deployments, scheduling, monitoring, and troubleshooting for multiple trading strategies. We are seeking an individual to help us solve complex problems and improve our processes and tools. The ideal candidate is someone with a strong sense of ownership who can anticipate challenges.Must be open to working a rotating schedule which will include US and Asia shifts.<p><br></p><strong><u>What Youll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitor the trading system and work to identify and resolve issues</li><li>Identify, diagnose and troubleshoot complex problems to keep trading online</li><li>Work with Risk and Trading desks to understand and facilitate trading requirements</li><li>Manage daily changes and communicate status to the company</li><li>Automate software distribution and deployments for Linux and Windows applications to speed up our application deployments</li><li>Build new tools to manage our system and reduce effort and errors</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>What Were Looking For:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field</li><li>Financial industry experience is required</li><li>1-3 years of experience using, managing, or developing on Linux systems</li><li>Fluent with Windows and Linux platforms</li><li>Proficient in a scripting language, preferably Python</li><li>Comfortable with distributed version control like Git, Mercurial, or Subversion</li><li>Familiar with configuration management systems like Salt, Puppet, or Chef</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring tools, such as Solarwinds, Nagios, Cacti, etc.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks with high attention to detail in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Motivated to identify and problem solve issues in a timely manner</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why Is This a Great Opportunity</u></strong><p><br></p>Client is a privately held global prop trading firm. Collaborative and innovative work culture. Great work life balance. Client typically moves fast throughout the interview process.<p><br></p><strong>Salary Type </strong>: Annual Salary<p><br></p><strong>Salary Min </strong>: 120000<p><br></p><strong>Salary Max </strong>: 140000<p><br></p><strong>Currency Type </strong>: US Dollars

title: Web Developer
description: <span><span><strong>Genesis10 is currently seeking an Application Programmer with our client in the financial industry located in Chicago, IL. This is a 12 + month contract position.<br><br>Responsibilities:</strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>Design and implementation of Credit Instrument and its associated lifecycle</span></span></li><li><span><span>Design and implementation of Pricers for various credit products</span></span></li><li><span><span>Develop relationships with the Quant and Financial Development Teams to resolve pricing related issues</span></span></li><li><span><span>Investigate and analyze legacy valuation result differences with quartz to ensure quartz-based implementation pricing is correct</span></span></li><li><span><span>Support BAU, end of day processing<br></span></span></li></ul><span><span><strong>Requirements:</strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>Quantitative Developer</span></span></li><li><span><span>Eager to learn</span></span></li><li><span><span>Able to contribute and work well in a collaborative team environment</span></span></li><li><span><span>Good communication skills</span></span></li><li><span><span>2+ years of hands-on development experience in object-oriented programing, e.g., Python, C++, or Java. etc.<br></span></span></li></ul><span><span><strong>Desired skills:</strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>Quantitative degree in Math, Physics, Engineering </span></span></li><li><span><span>Previous experience with python </span></span></li><li><span><span>Good knowledge of finance and security valuation <br></span></span></li></ul><span><span><strong>Pay Range:</strong> $50.45 - $58.45<br><br><strong>Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position.<br><br>If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply!<br><br>About Genesis10:<br></strong>Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals. <br><br><strong>For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client.  Benefits of Working with Genesis10: <br></strong></span></span><span><span>•    Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years. <br>•    The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. <br>•    Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.) <br>•    Behavioral Health Platform <br>•    Medical, Dental, Vision <br>•    Health Savings Account <br>•    Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness &amp; Accident) <br>•    Voluntary Term Life Insurance <br>•    401K <br>•    Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities) <br>•    Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF) <br>•    Remote opportunities available <br></span></span><span><span>For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website. <br><br>Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. <br></span></span>

title: Space TS/SCI - Staff Engineer Systems (Up to $15k in sign-on bonus for eligible candidates!)
description: Company Profile<p><br></p>esrhealthcare.com.mysmartjobboard.com<p><br></p>Embedded Systems engineer York pa<p><br></p>Experience level: Mid-senior Experience required: 2 Years Education level: Bachelor’s degree Job function: Information Technology Industry: Mining &amp; Metals Compensation: $71,000 - $80,000 Total position: 1<p><br></p>Overview:<p><br></p>Z seeking a skilled Embedded Systems Engineer for our East York, PA manufacturing location.<p><br></p>We are seeking a skilled Embedded Systems Engineer for our East York, PA manufacturing location.<p><br></p>The successful candidate will have a Bachelor's degree or higher in Electronic Engineering or Computer Science with a minor or coursework in hardware and software design, have at least two (2) years of professional working experience in a related field, have demonstrable coding proficiency with C/C++, have knowledge of commercial software qualification standards for process related/embedded systems; with at least two (2) years of practical working experience with programming, testing, data acquisition, electronic systems and PCB design.<p><br></p>Our office work environment includes:<p><br></p>Business casual work attire;<p><br></p>Dynamic team-based work environment;<p><br></p>Full-time 4.5 day work week that promotes work:life balance<p><br></p>This includes:<p><br></p>Monday thru Thursday 7:30 am to 5:30 pm with 30 minute lunch<p><br></p>Friday 7:30 am to 11:30 am.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>The Embedded Systems Engineer will have primary responsibility to develop and execute the complete embedded systems development lifecycle for the Company’s products with the goal of creating scalable and optimized software and hardware systems.<p><br></p>Duties and Responsibilities<p><br></p>The Embedded Systems Engineer will have core duties and responsibilities to include:<p><br></p>Design and implement software of embedded devices and systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment<p><br></p>Design and implement hardware embedded systems from requirements to production and commercial deployment, including design, schematic capture, component specification and PCB layouts<p><br></p>Design, develop, code, test and debug system software<p><br></p>Review code as well as hardware design<p><br></p>Analyze and enhance efficiency, stability and scalability of system resources<p><br></p>Integrate and validate new product designs<p><br></p>Support software QA and optimize I/O performance<p><br></p>Provide post production support<p><br></p>Interface with other design and development staff within Engineering Department<p><br></p>Assess third party and open source software<p><br></p><strong>General Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>At least three (2) years of professional industry experience in a related field.<p><br></p>Desired Characteristics<p><br></p>Highly-motivated self-starter with drive to succeed;<p><br></p>Exceptional communication skills and willingness to continually improve;<p><br></p>Familiarity with developing real time software for embedded systems;<p><br></p>Coding experience in C/C++;<p><br></p>Optional Coding experience in MATLAB, python, VBA, etc.;<p><br></p>Demonstrated collaboration, and facilitation skills;<p><br></p>Flexible, friendly and adaptive approach to working in a team-based culture;<p><br></p>Expertise with commercial software qualification process;<p><br></p>Familiarity with MODBUS, RS 422, RS 485 and CAN bus;<p><br></p>Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles;<p><br></p>Keen listener and innate drive to succeed;<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Education<p><br></p>At minimum a Bachelor’s degree in Electronic Engineering or Computer Science;<p><br></p>Minor or focused coursework in hardware and software design; and<p><br></p>Certification in C or C++ or an additional two ( 2) years practical experience.<p><br></p><strong>Required Professional Experience</strong><p><br></p>Proven working experience in embedded systems engineering;<p><br></p>Experience in hands-on development and troubleshooting on embedded targets;<p><br></p>Proven experience in embedded systems design with preemptive, multitasking real-time operating systems;<p><br></p>Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools, and peer review;<p><br></p>Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems;<p><br></p>Excellent knowledge of reading schematics and data sheets for components; and<p><br></p>Strong documentation and writing skills.<p><br></p>BONUS INCENTIVES<p><br></p>We provide a semi-annual bonus program to reward our employees for their success. Our program is based on your consistent, reliable work. Quality + Efficiency = $$$<p><br></p><strong>401k With Company Match</strong><p><br></p>We help our employees prepare for retirement. We provide a robust 401k plan with ROTH option and a company match.<p><br></p><strong>Company Paid Holidays</strong><p><br></p>We provide our employees with eighty (80) paid Holiday hours per calendar year.<p><br></p>DEI<p><br></p>Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are priorities for every aspect of our company and of our company culture.<p><br></p>EEO<p><br></p>We are an equal employment opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity , sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, age or other legally protected status.<p><br></p>EMPLOYEE WELL BEING<p><br></p>We provide a temperature controlled working environment with unlimited access to purified water and purified ice for our employees. We also provide onsite vending services with a variety of popular snacks, beverages and meals for your convenience.<p><br></p>COVID 19<p><br></p>We protect our employees with Covid-19 safety guidelines that include vaccination bonus incentive payments and monitoring of local risk. HR will manage reasonable accommodation of vaccination status if needed upon acceptance of employment.<p><br></p>Job Type: Full-time<p><br></p>Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year<p><br></p>Benefits:<p><br></p>401(k)<p><br></p>401(k) matching<p><br></p>Dental insurance<p><br></p>Employee assistance program<p><br></p>Health insurance<p><br></p>Life insurance<p><br></p>Paid time off<p><br></p>Vision insurance<p><br></p>Schedule:<p><br></p>Day shift<p><br></p>Monday to Friday<p><br></p>Supplemental pay types:<p><br></p>Bonus pay<p><br></p>Education:<p><br></p>Bachelor's (Required)<p><br></p>Experience:<p><br></p>coding: 2 years (Required)<p><br></p>coding review and debugging: 2 years (Required)<p><br></p>commercial software certification standards: 1 year (Required)<p><br></p>professional industry: 2 years (Required)<p><br></p>License/Certification:<p><br></p>Certification in C or C++ or an additional two ( 2) years practical experience.<p><br></p>Work Location: In person<p><br></p>Powered by Webbtree

title: Technology Operations Engineer
description: <strong>AWS Data Engineer Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Location – Chicago is the preference<p><br></p>On site schedule – every other week, for 2 days<p><br></p>Interviews- senior architect will participate, technical. No coding challenges.<p><br></p><strong>Revenue management department. </strong><p><br></p><strong>Focus is the AWS migration</strong>.<p><br></p>They are doing both lift and shift and utilizing and implementing new solutions.<p><br></p>Given the amount of work they have, they are utilizing outside partners as well (IBM, TCS).<p><br></p>Current project is very critical.<p><br></p>They are also using TCS for the implementation here. It’s a large team, 40 people on the project staff from TCS, 7-8 United employees.<p><br></p>TCS is doing a lot of design for the solution here.<p><br></p>They need this person to coordinate closely with TCS and their business partners.<p><br></p>Tteam does a lot of enhancements and changes to the software in AWS for the revenue management group overall.<p><br></p>They will not be tied to just one application.<p><br></p><strong>This team works with a lot of data processing as well. </strong><p><br></p>This person will be heavily integrated into this space.<p><br></p>They would also like this person to contribute to support the larger team.<p><br></p>Must Have-<p><br></p>AWS and services (Batch, EMR would stand out) – Data processing area specifically and how they process it.<p><br></p>They use Aurora and MySQL for databases, AWS Redshift is also a huge plus<p><br></p>Python<p><br></p>Agile method background<p><br></p>3+ years in AWS is highly preferred.<p><br></p>Nice to have –<p><br></p>AWS redshift<p><br></p>Java is a big plus<p><br></p>Certifications

title: Application Programmer
description: dsfsdfsdf<br><br>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br>In our growing engineering organization, you’ll be developing and shipping new features and updates to Lever’s product. You’ll be learning about our real-time web stack UI frameworks that help us deliver a beautiful and high quality solution to our customers. You’ll work collaboratively with product managers and designers to drive the implementation and release of major features, and be a champion of best practices for writing well-tested, well-organized code.<br><br>You’ll become familiar with all parts of our stack from end to end. You’ll design and implement your features to be scalable and resilient. That might include challenges like the complexities of a real-time, single-page web application, scaling backend services under high load, and developing search algorithms to enable unique features. You’ll be a driver for positive change to Lever’s engineering culture, processes and technology.<br><br>THE TEAM<br><br>You’ll join a team where everyone—including you—is striving to constantly improve their knowledge of infrastructure, systems, and cares about minimizing downtime. We are an incredibly supportive team–we love to pitch in when problems arise and give great peer feedback to help each other grow. We are passionate about lots of things--automation, friendly chat bots, creating a great hiring experience, and a great user experience--and we love sharing those passions with each other. You'll be a key driver of instilling these values in our new Toronto office and play a big role in helping grow the team.<br><br>WITHIN 1 MONTH, YOU'LL<br><ul><li>Complete Ramp Camp, Lever’s company-wide onboarding program. You’ll meet other new Leveroos in your cohort, and learn the nuts and bolts of the business, our history, and where we’re going.</li><li>You'll also complete your Starter Project, designed to help you build bridges with other Leveroos and positively contribute to your team’s processes and knowledge</li><li>Tackle your first ticket!</li><li>Dive into Lever’s technology by by pair-programming with your teammates and attending engineering training sessions designed and presented by your peers.</li></ul>WITHIN 3 MONTHS, YOU'LL<br><ul><li>Learn Lever’s technical stack and apply development patterns through your work</li><li>Participate in Lever’s product development process and ship your first feature to customers.</li><li>Engage in your first on-call rotation in Support Engineering to help diagnose and resolve production problems and customer issues.</li><li>Write internal documentation for your features and systems so other engineers and stakeholders are brought along with your decisions</li></ul>sdfdsfsdfsdf

title: Embedded Systems engineer York pa
description: <strong>SUMMARY:</strong><p><br></p>The Endpoint Engineer is a key member of the Endpoint Management team at Winston &amp; Strawn, an international law firm with more than 900 attorneys in 16 offices around the world. The Endpoint Management team is responsible for the development, deployment, maintenance and support of the firm's physical and virtual desktop environments and mobile devices, as well as the technologies used to manage these platforms.<p><br></p>This engineering role is responsible for the administration and day-to-day operations of the firm's user-facing systems, including hardware selection; operating system imaging, configuration, and certification; inventory availability or capacity planning; application deployment and security policy compliance, all with the end goal of delivering a stable, reliable, and elegant computing environment.<p><br></p>The Endpoint Engineer will be the owner of one or more of the firm's management solutions (Microsoft Intune, Endpoint Manager, Citrix Cloud, etc.), and will be responsible for keeping pace with the firm's continued investment in leading-edge technologies to deliver, configure and secure access to the firm's cloud-based and on-prem systems.<p><br></p>The Endpoint Engineer will leverage the firm's monitoring and analytics software to proactively identify issues and trends that impact user satisfaction and productivity, and will make recommendations on new technologies, services, and practices to deliver an exceptional user experience for the firm's attorneys and staff.<p><br></p><strong>DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><p><br></p>This role includes defining, building, and operating solutions for the firm's end-user compute environments. Responsibilities include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in the evaluation and definition of the User Experience, specifying standards for how applications and desktops should perform, anticipating user interaction with upgrades and patch management, optimizing user interfaces, and ensuring intuitive, elegant system design and optimal supportability.</li><li>Defining procedures for imaging desktop and laptop hardware, including evaluation and testing of BIOS version, BIOS configuration and device drivers, and virtual machines, including virtual hardware specifications.</li><li>Assisting in the planning and execution of upgrade cycles for the Windows OS, major core applications, and other enterprise applications.</li><li>Working with the firm's Enterprise Applications, IT Operations, and Risk teams to define and evolve new ways of delivering applications to any device.</li><li>Defining and implementing standard policies, procedures, and processes for endpoint device management, including operating system and application deployment, application packaging and configuration, and the securing of the environment against the installation or execution of unapproved applications.</li><li>Assisting in the vulnerability management efforts of the firm following the standards set by the firm's Information Risk Management team, including the deployment of security patches using an enterprise patch management solution and the configuration of security controls such as AppLocker application whitelisting, NTFS permissions, and Windows Firewall rules.</li><li>Demonstrating expert-level proficiency with key technologies to be supported, including willingness and ability to develop expertise in new technologies as needed.</li><li>Driving innovation and continuous improvement of the end user computing environment. </li><li>Evaluating the impact of relevant emerging technology and business trends.</li><li>Providing technical and operational governance across the firm's end-user computing environment.</li><li>Offering excellent third-tier knowledge and support to first- and second-tier technical support analysts during issue escalation, coordinating problem evaluation and troubleshooting efforts with other IS staff.</li><li>Recommending and supporting new tools, techniques, and technologies for workstation and mobile device management.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or 5 + years equivalent work experience required.</li><li>5+ years of IT Infrastructure or desktop experience creating or maintaining enterprise level systems, management and or architecture, ideally in a multi-domain, multi-datacenter environment required.</li><li>Must have “hands-on” experience with Windows and Citrix management technologies (Active Directory, SCCM, XenApp/XenDesktop).</li><li>Must be certified in, or actively pursuing a certification in, at least one of the core management technologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of engineering experience with Windows 10, Windows Server 2016, Office 365, SCCM, Mac OSX, Apple iOS, and Android.</li><li>Strong working knowledge of automation and scripting (PowerShell and/or Python).</li><li>Exceptional interpersonal, leadership, and organizational skills, with the ability to schedule and coordinate multiple activities in results-oriented environment.</li><li>Effective communication skills, both written and oral.</li><li>Must have customer service attitude and ability to work well with other groups.</li><li>Must subscribe to being highly available and responsive to occasional after-hours issues, as the firm operates on a near 24x7 basis.</li><li>Experience in the legal market a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p>We value diversity in the workplace. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled (EOE=Equal Opportunity Employer)<p><br></p>

title: Financial Analyst (entry level)
description: We are looking for Software Engineers to help us dramatically expand and improve our set of products while simultaneously supporting a massive increase in the capacity of our systems. We have been extremely picky about assembling a team of smart, humble people who are passionate about creating amazing products. We work in an agile manner and believe strongly that small cross-functional teams empowered to make decisions and move fast are the best way to do so. This is an unbeatable opportunity for developers who hope to work on and deliver world class software in a friendly, fun, and innovative environment.<br><br>Some Challenges You’ll Tackle<br><br>Design, implement, and deliver awesome technical platforms and products for all constituencies (diners, corporate accounts, restaurants, internal tools)<br><br>Understand our products from both a technical and business perspective in the context of our larger business.<br><br>Communicate with leadership, product owners, other technologists, and users to create working software based on an understanding of business and technical priorities.<br><br>Break down complex problems into elegant technical solutions to intelligently solve problems for diners, restaurant, corporate accounts and internal stakeholders.

title: AWS Data Engineer
description: Description:<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Developing customized solutions within the Salesforce platform. </li><li> Designing, coding, and implementing Salesforce applications. Creating timelines and development goals. </li><li> Testing the stability and functionality of the application. </li><li> Troubleshooting and fixing bugs. </li><li> Writing documents and providing technical training for Salesforce staff. </li><li> Maintaining the security and integrity of the application software. </li></ul><p><br></p>Salesforce Developer Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in computer science or software engineering. </li><li> Previous work experience with application and software development. </li><li> Experience developing customer-facing interfaces. </li><li> Advanced knowledge of Salesforce CRM platforms. </li><li> Proficient in MYSQL, Apex, JavaScript, Native, and VisualForce. </li><li> Working knowledge of mavensMate or eclipse. </li><li> Good communication skills. </li><li> Ability to problem-solve high-level software and application issues. </li><li> Ability to project manage.</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>TITLE: </strong>Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst - 23-12037<p><br></p><strong>LOCATION: </strong>Arlington Heights, IL area<p><br></p><strong>STATUS: </strong>Hybrid (2 days in office, 3 days remote)<p><br></p><strong>OVERVIEW OF THE POSITION:</strong> A global automotive and industrial parts manufacturing company is partnering with TeamBradley to add a Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst to their team. This person will be part of the financial modules/JD Edwards Enterprise. The right candidate will have a strong knowledge of financial functions and JDE Integration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Brief Snapshot</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide support for sales and manufacturing plants. </li><li>Troubleshoot software issues and impellent technical solutions.</li><li>Implement the JDE Financial module.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree. </li><li>Strong knowledge in JD Edwards AR, AP &amp; G/L.</li><li>Knowledge of Manufacturing Accounting/Cost Accounting.</li><li>Knowledgeable in creating JDE E1 Pages, Watchlists, Alerts, JDE Café One, and JDE UX One.</li><li>Familiar with Hubble Financial.</li><li>Strong SQL &amp; Excel skills.</li><li>Familiarity with JDE Distribution, Procurement, and Manufacturing is a plus.</li><li>Familiar with IBM Query/400 a plus. </li></ul> <strong>WHEN RESPONDING TO THIS OPPORTUNITY:</strong> Resumes without the required technical skills and experience will not be considered. Although a strong desire for a certain type of position is a credit to your goal, experience is necessary. Our client is not considering sponsorship currently and is not open to relocation expenses.<p><br></p><strong>Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst - 23-12037</strong><p><br></p><strong>#IND1</strong>

title: Endpoint Engineer (Hybrid)
description: To provide technical excellence in developing firmware associated with high volume electronic products associated with the AMI industry. Participate in the development of project plans including reviewing and evaluating code and other deliverables produced by the team. Participates in product deployment and provide leadership in resolving customer technical support issues. Functions as technical lead when required.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Firmware design, coding, test and documentation for micro controller based products.</li><li>Develop firmware functional specifications and requirements documentation for new products.</li><li>Contribute to cost estimates and schedules for firmware development tasks.</li><li>Develop design verification test requirements and create test reports.</li><li>Develop, maintain and champion structured firmware processes.</li><li>Guide engineers through proper firmware design processes for high reliability firmware</li><li>Analyze and resolve field problems.</li><li>Supervise the work and tasks of other engineers on project teams.</li><li>Develop unit and integration test requirements and methodologies and processes.</li><li>Develop new techniques and apply existing techniques for designing, developing and testing high reliability firmware.</li><li>Participate in technical reviews of the work performed by the group.</li></ul>Qualifications<br><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.</li><li>Ten years of aggregate Engineering experience in which may include graduate thesis work.</li><li>Ten years of experience in analysis, design, coding, and testing C code for embedded systems.</li><li>A minimum of 3 years’ leading a development effort.</li><li>Project estimation/tracking experience.</li><li>Work equally well independently and at the direction of others.</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Working knowledge of networking protocols (SEP, Wi-Fi, ZigBee, IPv4/6).</li><li>Working knowledge of assembler.</li><li>Advanced engineering degree.</li><li>Electronic communication systems background.</li><li>Experience working with RF systems.</li><li>Experience in the utility industry.</li></ul>

title: Software Engineer
description: *Hybrid, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote*<p><br></p>A prestigious financial firm needs a DevOps Support Engineer. This engineer will focus on DevOps support, maintenance, and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS. This individual will need to possess skills with Java, Python, AWS, DevOps, CICD, Kubernetes, Kafka, Jenkins, Github, Ansible, etc.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enable development teams to self-service build and deployment processes through process automation.</li><li>Design and implement process improvements across the build, deployment, and monitoring of Clearing applications.</li><li>Support the maintenance and configuration of development environments in Kubernetes and AWS.</li><li>Develop and support terraform, ansible, Harness, and Jenkins jobs used to instantiate and manage development environments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field, or equivalent experience</li><li>1+ years of experience in building large scale, data-centric solutions</li><li>3+ years of experience (recent) participating on a DevOps team or as product owner for DevOps team</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go is required.</li><li>Knowledge and experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools (examples - GitHub, Jenkins, Artifactory, Docker, Compose, K8s).</li><li>Java development experience is desirable.</li><li>Experience with distributed message brokers like Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, Amazon Kinesis, etc.</li><li>Experience with cloud technologies and migrations is required.</li><li>Experience preferred with AWS foundational services like VPCs, Security groups, EC2, RDS, S3 ACLs, KMS, AWS CLI and IAM etc.</li><li>Experience developing and delivering technical solutions using public cloud service providers like Amazon, Google, etc.</li><li>Familiarity with monitoring related tools and frameworks like Splunk, ElasticSearch, Prometheus, AppDynamics. Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc. is required.</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON RPC. Experience following Git workflows.</li></ul>

title: Salesforce Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint Developer), you will be responsible for building, configuring, and customizing a modern Intranet solution utilizing modern SharePoint &amp; Microsoft Viva Connections. Additionally, you will own and build out the governance process for managing M365 integrations, MS graph API, power automate, and power applications. Responsibilities include building systems according to company specifications, building Microsoft Viva adaptive cards, writing, and modifying code, debugging software and training staff.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the following skills: Modern SharePoint Design, Microsoft Graph API, UI/UX design process, proficient with .Net, JavaScript, C#, CSS &amp; HTML, Microsoft framework, and automation applications (power applications, power automate).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Delivers technology solutions that support business goals. Partners with the product owner to understand business requirements, evaluates features, and translates application specifications into workable technical solutions.</li><li>Maintains application software and systems. Ensures all projects and releases are appropriately tested and risks are mitigated. </li><li>Oversees and reviews development activities of team members and contractors.</li><li>Supports technical initiatives and provides input best practices to team.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In depth knowledge with PowerShell scripting and automation builds</li><li>Familiar with Jira and Agile Scrum methods (ceremonies)</li><li>Actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy event</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview<p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p>#BI-Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>
description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint Developer), you will be responsible for building, configuring, and customizing a modern Intranet solution utilizing modern SharePoint &amp; Microsoft Viva Connections. Additionally, you will own and build out the governance process for managing M365 integrations, MS graph API, power automate, and power applications. Responsibilities include building systems according to company specifications, building Microsoft Viva adaptive cards, writing, and modifying code, debugging software and training staff.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the following skills: Modern SharePoint Design, Microsoft Graph API, UI/UX design process, proficient with .Net, JavaScript, C#, CSS &amp; HTML, Microsoft framework, and automation applications (power applications, power automate).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Delivers technology solutions that support business goals. Partners with the product owner to understand business requirements, evaluates features, and translates application specifications into workable technical solutions.</li><li>Maintains application software and systems. Ensures all projects and releases are appropriately tested and risks are mitigated. </li><li>Oversees and reviews development activities of team members and contractors.</li><li>Supports technical initiatives and provides input best practices to team.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In depth knowledge with PowerShell scripting and automation builds</li><li>Familiar with Jira and Agile Scrum methods (ceremonies)</li><li>Actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy event</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview<p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p>#BI-Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst
description: Salary: $130k-$145k + bonus<p><br></p>Location: Hybrid role in either location<p><br></p>Chicago, IL/Dallas, TX<p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's or Master's Degrees in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.</li><li>Minimum of 5-8 years of experience in Site Reliability Engineering/DevOps</li><li>Experience managing infrastructure in public cloud environments like AWS (preferred), Azure or GCP.</li><li>Experience providing visibility using monitoring and alerting tools like Splunk, SignalFx, AppDynamics, Datadog, ELK, Prometheus or Grafana.</li><li>Experience with container orchestration systems like Kubernetes, Mesos, Docker Swarm or Rancher.</li><li>Experience with infrastructure as code and configuration management tools like Terraform, Ansible, Puppet or Chef.</li><li>Programming/Scripting experience in languages like Java, Bash, Python or Go.</li><li>Experience with distributed messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or ActiveMQ.</li><li>Experience with using Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools like Jenkins, Travis, Harness, Spinnaker, Appveyor, CodeBuild or CodePipeline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with development, operations and infrastructure teams to ensure availability of services, and to work through implementation issues.</li><li>Develop automation for incident response and to prevent problem recurrence</li><li>Create and enhance runbooks to respond to service outages or degradations</li><li>Assess the production readiness of services</li><li>Define and track operational metrics for production performance, reliability, scalability and availability</li><li>Architect, develop and maintain shared services and tools to improve reliability and reduce toil across the organization</li><li>Contribute to the team's continuous improvement through research, retrospectives, discussion groups and code reviews</li><li>Provide leadership within the team by guiding and mentoring junior members, and preparing stories for the sprint backlog</li></ul>
