title: Firmware Engineer
description: Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks <strong>seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>This is an environment <strong>unlike anything in the high-tech world </strong>and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.<p><br></p>Come join the <strong>Costco Wholesale IT family</strong>. Costco IT is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees.<p><br></p>Engineers have deep knowledge and hands-on experience in enterprise-wide platforms, and solve technical problems while working on technology initiatives. Engineers have strong architectural, leadership, and technical skills. They ensure delivery of high quality artifacts, and adhere to and follow Costco’s SDLC. Engineers interact in a highly effective manner with other team members and management, drive innovation, and influence delivery and performance.<p><br></p>The<strong>Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)</strong>will be responsible for maintaining and improving the availability, performance, and capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution. The SRE will translate Costco’s goals and strategies for system availability, performance, and capacity into designs and plans for technical solutions. The SRE will work with other members of the International Ecommerce team, other Costco employees, and Costco suppliers to implement these solutions. The SRE will also work with the rest of the Global eCommerce team to resolve issues affecting the availability, performance or capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution.<p><br></p>The SRE will also work with other members of the Global eCommerce team to identify upcoming events that could affect demand on system performance and prepare mitigation plans. The SRE will work with the DevOps team and system architects to implement, maintain, and validate disaster recovery plans and other solutions to avoid or mitigate service interruptions.<p><br></p>The SRE will monitor the availability, performance, and capacity of Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution to identify trends and concerns. Create and disseminate system reliability reports to Costco management in support of planning and decision making. The SRE will also assist in the development of policies, standards, and guidelines for the maintenance and operation of Costco’s overall SAP Commerce Solution.<p><br></p>Additionally, this role will partner with other members of the Technical Operations team, including the Technical Operations Manager, the Software Configuration Engineer, the DevOps team, and the Services Management Team.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide<strong> <u>BEST companies “to work for”,</u></strong> simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong><u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partners with project managers, solution leads, and other stakeholders to establish the rough order of magnitude estimates, to create and maintain a robust framework to support applications, and to deliver quality solutions.</li><li>Contributes, interprets, and communicates enterprise, technical, project, and operational strategies to the team.</li><li>Works with teams, management, and stakeholders to conceptualize, design, build, test, and release products</li><li>Shares relevant information among teams.</li><li>Influences and drives adoption of best practices and high quality standards throughout the division.</li><li>Integrates diverse solution components across multiple platforms using industry standard interfaces.</li><li>Tests and resolves problems, performs root cause analysis, identifies gaps, recommends solutions and preventative measures, and leads team members to solution delivery plans.</li><li>Runs proof of concepts and uses diagnostic/debugging skills to solve current challenges in multi-platform systems.</li><li>Orchestrates reviews for system additions and/or enhancements.</li><li>Promotes and supports a culture of compliance, risk avoidance/mitigation, and corporate accountability throughout the organization through technical leadership, knowledge of business need, development and communication of policies, procedures, and plans, and assurance of solution designs that are in compliance with architecture standards, technology guardrails, security, and operational guidelines.</li><li>Provides leadership/mentoring to team members; implements development efficiencies; creates appropriate documentation; drives operational efficiencies and technical growth within the team; and supports the release model.</li><li>Optimizes team efficiency and performance through high level technical direction.</li><li>Provides technical leadership in implementation of applications, strategic planning sessions, documentation of requirements, tool implementation, database query languages, and programming languages.</li><li>Assists in management and operation of site reliability functions related to Costco’s SAP Commerce Solution.</li><li>Develops, establishes, and enforces policies, standards, and guidelines for site reliability.</li><li>Identifies, designs, develops, and deploys tools and processes to monitor, maintain, and report site performance and availability.</li><li>Tracks system performance, capacity, and use experience to create effective strategies for maintaining and improving system performance and availability. Advises the International Ecommerce team on said strategies.</li><li>Uses communication and documentation tools (Jira, BitBucket, Bamboo, Jenkins, etc.) to communicate and coordinate with other team members.</li><li>Applies technical expertise to lead the resolution of system issues related to system performance, availability, and capacity.</li><li>Contributes to and maintains an in-depth understanding of the Non Production and Production architectures, including the hosted server environments, deployed applications, integrated packages, and 3rd party operational tools, particularly as they relate to system performance, availability, and capacity.</li><li>Works with the design, development, QA, technical operations teams, as well as other stakeholders, to maintain the performance, availability, and integrity of Costco’s SAP Commerce solution.</li><li>Communicates effectively with project teams and other participants in ongoing system development to identify and resolve issues, explain solutions, and provide technical expertise.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in the development, maintenance, and operation of highly available Ecommerce sites, specifically those based on SAP Commerce.</li><li>Expertise in the use of monitoring and reporting tools for performance and capacity analysis (e.g., Zabbix, App Dynamics, etc.).</li><li>Expertise in performance testing for web applications.</li><li>Knowledge of Java, Linux, and Relational Database systems (particularly MySQL).</li><li>Hands-on experience operating and maintaining high-availability Ecommerce systems. Past experience tuning and maintaining the performance of Java and Linux systems is desirable.</li><li>Ability to prototype and demonstrate mechanisms for performance improvement, high availability, and system scaling.</li><li>Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills, as well as a positive attitude.</li><li>Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills.</li><li>Demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.</li><li>Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly.</li><li>Able to work independently.</li><li>Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans.</li><li>Flexible; must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines.</li><li>Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables with a strong sense of urgency.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel internationally and adjust work hours to accommodate international teams.</li><li>Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business in a 24x7x365 operations environment - evening, weekend, and holiday work.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge preferred.</li><li>Familiarity with Atlassian tools (including JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo).</li><li>Familiarity with scripting tools, including shell scripts, Groovy, Python, and/or Perl.</li><li>Familiarity with principles of Continuous Integration and deployment practices.</li><li>Ability to research and introduce new technologies, practices, and techniques; open to continued learning.</li><li>Familiarity with Program and Project Management practices.</li><li>Experience working on medium and large-scale projects, under both traditional and agile development methodologies.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle processes, as well as demonstrated experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies.</li><li>Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus.</li><li>Familiarity with the SAP Commerce platform (hybris) is desirable.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cover Letter</li><li>Resume</li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Ranges</u></strong><p><br></p>Level 2 - $145,000 - $175,000, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>Level 3 - $165,000 - $195,000, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>Level 4 - $185,000 - $220,000, Bonus and Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) eligible<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits - medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. In some cases, applicants and employees for selected positions will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

title: DevOps Engineer
description: <strong>Quality Assurance Analyst (Manual)<br><br></strong><strong>Pay: </strong>$60-$70 w2<br><br><strong>Contract Length:</strong> 6 months contract (potential extension)<br><br><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (hybrid)<br><br></strong><strong><u>Note<br><br></u></strong>This is a Manual Tester, automation tools knowledge is not required, but it is a huge nice to have. It is important that the candidate have experience in cross browser, cross platform web and mobile testing and their dev tools that come with them.<br><br><strong><u>Purpose<br><br></u></strong>Quality Assurance Analyst will report to QA Manager. The Quality Assurance Analyst's role is to develop and establish quality assurance standards and measures for the information technology services within the organization.<br><br><strong><u>Position Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements.</li><li> Write test plans and scripts for tracking defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems, and operations systems.</li><li> Develop and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for new development and enhancements.</li><li> Create and execute test plans and scripts that will determine application quality.</li><li> Communicate test progress, test results, and quality of application changes.</li><li> Analyze test results to discover and report out on defects.</li><li> Work with business community to plan and execute UAT.</li><li> Assist in environment setup and management in preparation for test execution.</li><li> Experience with writing acceptance criteria.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience And Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>10+ years direct experience as a lead tester for major application integration and/or major application product release.</li><li>Strong knowledge of system testing best practices and methodologies.</li><li>Extensive experience with core software applications.</li><li>Direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, manual testing tools, and reporting software.</li><li>Experience with statistical reporting and analysis.</li><li>Good project management skills and/or substantial exposure to project-based work structures.</li><li>Experience with communication tools like MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PowerPoint.</li><li>Comfortable with test planning and tracking tools<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Have Tools<br></u></strong><ul><li>Familiarity in testing APIs/services (REST and SOAP) using SoapUI, Postman or equivalent tools</li><li>Experience in cross browser, cross platform web and mobile testing and their dev tools that come with them</li><li>Proficient in leveraging Splunk or similar tools to view system logs and troubleshoot potential defects</li><li>Experience with communication tools like MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PowerPoint, MS Teams</li><li>Comfortable with test planning and tracking tools such as Confluence, Jira, Zephyr</li><li>HIGHLY DESIRED*</li><li>Familiarity in Java, XML, JS, CSS and HTML</li><li>Familiarity with SauceLabs or equivalent tools</li><li>Direct hands-on experience with Java and/or Groovy, test automation frameworks, Selenium/Appium, with ad hoc query programs, and reporting software</li><li>Familiarity in version control systems like Git and Subversion</li><li>Familiarity in Java, XML, JS, CSS and HTML</li><li>Sound knowledge of Jenkins for Continuous Integration.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education<br></u></strong><ul><li>Four year college degree<br></li></ul>#PCIT<br><br>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint Developer)
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>As a DevOps Engineer for our client, you will be a core, pivotal, and transformational member of the engineering team. You will work as an integral part of our agile teams in analyzing, designing, building, and testing high quality cloud deployment methodologies and systems. Working on a team under the leadership of senior architects, you will be building the future of our state-of-the-art cloud-based platforms. This position will be fully responsible for our platform and application pipelines, and the flow of code updates through the engineering group, as well as creating and monitoring highly available cloud infrastructure and platforms to host that code. This opportunity will involve working on multiple technologies, especially cloud platform services.<br><br><strong><u>Your Responsibilities In This Role<br><br></u></strong>Responsibilities will span production, development, and testing environments.Responsibilities will be diverse including cloud architecture and infrastructure, build tooling and dev-ops systems and processes.<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Strong communication and technical writing skills.</li><li> Be a team-player and brainstorm with other developers/senior developers on ideas, workflows, and technologies</li><li> Display flexibility to adapt to change and willing to learn and develop new skill sets as applicable.</li><li> Exhibit ability to plan and manage multiple deliverables in a highly energized and fast-paced environment.</li><li> Excellent technical, logical, analytical, and problem-solving skills</li><li> Strong experience in Azure, Terraform, Puppet, and Python<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. By clicking “Apply Now,” you’re agreeing to

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description: <ul><li>Position- Lead .Net Developer</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Location - </strong><strong>Chicago, IL </strong><strong>(</strong><strong>Hybrid 3 days in a week in an office</strong><strong>)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration -Full Time</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>10+ years of experience designing and developing applications.</li><li>Hands on experience on WPF(with MVVM pattern), .NET with SQL Server</li><li>Knowledge on various design patterns and able to provide low level design for modules.</li><li>Experience working on smaller database design.</li><li>Ability to write complex stored procedures, optimizing the same.</li><li>Ability to integrate with other applications using APIs.</li><li>Experience in work in Agile</li><li>Ability to mentor the team and help juniors.</li><li>Onsite-offshore coordination skills and ability to work with customer technical team (For onsite person)</li><li>Good Analytical and problem-solving skills.</li><li>Good Communication skills</li><li>Should work in customer location in IL, Chicago as per their hybrid policy.</li></ul>

title: QA Engineer-Manual
description: <strong>Job#: 1355545</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Role: Property Systems Technical Engineer </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: REMOTE </strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration: 6 month + contract </strong><p><br></p><strong>Client: Large Hotel Client </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>If you are interested, please email your resume to Matt at **</li><li> The Property Systems Technical Engineer assume responsibility in either support or project engineering roles.</li><li> In both the roles the Property Systems Technical Engineer will communicate with various teams to deliver the required tasks towards Property Systems implementation and operation. Those include incident management tasks and ITIL best practices for Property Systems Technical Engineers allocated to support and project specific tasks and runbook implementation for those allocated to the project team.</li><li> They acquire knowledge from all available channels and share with colleagues in order to improve the knowledge level of the Property Systems team.</li><li> They are self-driven, motivated and quick-learners in Property System and automation field.</li></ul><p><br></p>TEAM AND OFFICE STRUCTURE:<p><br></p><ul><li> They work remotely and will be available for possible onsite visits up to 4 times a year.</li><li> Report to the managers of support or projects depending on their assigned role.</li><li> Candidate is expected to put in approximately 40 hours per week.</li><li> Occasional overtime is expected if crunch time requires it.</li><li> Occasional late-night hours may be required when supervising off-hours action items.</li></ul><p><br></p>WHAT IS OPERA:<p><br></p><ul><li> Web based application vital to daily hotel operations (Front desk check-in, back office accounting, interfaces to 200 other systems like door locks, TVs, and point of sell.)</li><li> Critical to other core systems being hosted in datacenters worldwide.</li></ul><p><br></p>POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:<p><br></p>DELIVERABLES:<p><br></p><ul><li> Support new technologies and the roll-out of new products and systems in coordination with other teams.</li><li> Provide technical guidance on operational issues affecting Opera Property Systems.</li><li> Maintain channels of communication with the related application technicians to ensure successful and efficient production changes.</li><li> Coordinate communication with the third-party technical vendors and internal teams for planned events, outages, etc.</li><li> Acquire oversight for the Opera Property Systems project tasks including planning, implementation, monitoring, maintenance and diagnostics.</li><li> Participate in the development and implementation of related systems that require communication to/from our hosted application.</li><li> Coordinate all modifications and changes to property systems with the technical team and carry out the changes as agreed upon the reviewed solution.</li><li> Performs trend analysis on monitoring alarms, incident reports and service ticket to resolve identified issues.</li><li> Provides on-call or after-hours technical support for the group.</li></ul><p><br></p>SAMPLE PROJECTS (FOR INDIVIDUALS ALLOCATED TO THE PROJECT TEAM):<p><br></p><ul><li> Upgrade Opera grids to the new application versions received from the vendor</li><li> Standing up a new datacenter or Azure environment in another region</li><li> Migrating Opera servers and data from standalone servers to the datacenter</li><li> Implement EMV payment gateway interface between the datacenter and payment processing companies</li><li> Testing disaster recovery readiness</li><li> Implementing interfaces/services of additional vendors to/from Opera</li><li> Building additional non-prod environments to give internal testers more varied test configurations</li></ul><p><br></p>EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle Opera installation experience is highly preferred.</li><li> 5 Years Windows Administrator Experience.</li><li> 1-2 Years Network experience (F5, VIP theory, DNS, Certificates)</li><li> 1-2 Years working with virtual environments (VSphere)</li><li> 1-2 Years working with scripting or automation platforms (PowerShell, Ansible, Etc.)</li></ul><p><br></p>PREFERRED SKILLS:<p><br></p>WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING TOOLSETS IS PREFERRED:<p><br></p>MAIN APPLICATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle Opera Property Systems and its dedicated interfaces.</li></ul><p><br></p>DATABASE:<p><br></p><ul><li> Oracle DB, RAC and SCAN (11g,12c,19c)</li></ul><p><br></p>AUTOMATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> PowerShell (Scripting of manual windows functions/tasks or installations of software)</li><li> Ansible (YAML scripting and playbooks)</li><li> Rundeck (Implement scripted jobs to run ad hoc or on a fixed schedule)</li><li> Jenkins (Automation of tasks related to building, testing and deploying software)</li></ul><p><br></p>MONITORING:<p><br></p><ul><li> Splunk (Scripting, GUI buildouts)</li><li> Nagios (Scripting, Unix Shell)</li></ul><p><br></p>WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF THE FOLLOWING APPLICATIONS/PLATFORMS:<p><br></p><ul><li> FIM and Active Directory (Security and Distribution Groups)</li><li> Citrix (Dedicated Server Farms in multiple environments)</li><li> Tumbleweed (SFTP Servers)</li><li> VMWare (Vpshere)</li><li> SQL Developer (Connection strings, building queries, running scripts, analysis)</li></ul><p><br></p>SKILLS NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS JOB:<p><br></p><ul><li> Experience in Oracle hospitality property management systems</li><li> Experience in Opera PMS installation and troubleshooting</li><li> Experience in Opera interface implementation</li></ul><p><br></p>ADDITIONAL COMMENTS AND REQUIREMENTS:<p><br></p><ul><li> Must be able to educate, train or mentor other members within the team with internal tools and skill sets.</li><li> Must be able to work in a multicultural environment.</li><li> Hotel / Hospitality operations experience preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>EDUCATION:<p><br></p><ul><li> University Degree in Information Systems or Information Technology.</li><li> Or, university degree in hospitality with technical background in hospitality systems.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at or .<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.

title: DevOps/Cloud Engineer
description: Lever builds software for teams to source, interview, and hire top talent. Our team strives to set a new bar for enterprise software with modern, well-designed, real-time apps. We participated in Y Combinator in summer 2012, and since then have raised $33 million. This year, we're doubling the team in size, and we're looking forward to supporting more great companies like Netflix, Eventbrite, and Lyft.<br><br>Under the hood, we're a technology company with a powerful open-source web framework: DerbyJS. It is the first and only open-source MVC framework that syncs all data via an Operational Transformation backend, using the same algorithm that powers Google Docs. DerbyJS is also uniquely optimized to render everything on the server as well as the client.<br><br>Own improvements to existing services as Lever scales to increasing usage and increasingly large enterprise accounts. Identify and anticipate performance bottlenecks across all Lever services and applications. Establish best practices, bridging between platform and product engineering.<br><br>Backend engineering is part of Lever's small platform engineering team that works directly with our CTO. Backend engineers improve the overall performance, reliability, and ability to measure existing systems. They collaborate with the product engineering team, who own full stack implementation of new features.<br><br>You will be able to teach peers patterns and best practices for production systems learned in previous roles as well as those gained from a broad understanding of Lever systems. At the same time, you'll learn from the unique challenges operating a large scale realtime, eventually consistent data model. Our applications are powered by ShareDB, our distributed realtime application backend. ShareDB syncs all data via Operational Transformation, the same algorithm that powers Google Docs.<br><br>Improve user experience and engagement via performance and reliability improvements, help product engineering to continue focusing on feature innovation and product differentiation, and level up in a broad range of technical and communication skills.<br><br><strong><u>Core Technologies<br><br></u></strong>JavaScript, Node.js, MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch, DerbyJS, ShareDB, IMAP, SMTP, Gmail and Google Calendar, Microsoft Exchange, AWS<br><br>Within 1 month, you’ll…<br><ul><li>Complete Lever’s new-hire training week (a.k.a. Ramp Camp), and learn what it means to build a powerful recruiting platform.</li><li>Ramp up on Lever’s engineering stack by pair-programming with your teammates and attending engineering training sessions designed and presented by your peers.</li><li>Complete your engineering starter project and deploy your first changes to production!</li></ul>Within 3 months, you’ll…<br><ul><li>Implement more efficient real-time indexing pipeline from MongoDB into Elasticsearch</li><li>Implement on demand reindexing of Elasticsearch for an account or all accounts without interruption of service</li></ul>Within 6 months, you’ll…<br><ul><li>Write improved data migrations frameworkMeasure capacity and latency of email sync service, project upcoming needs based on historical growth, and increase throughput to handle needs for 12 months from now</li><li>Update reporting data pipeline to use continuous MongoDB oplog tailing</li><li>Work closely with product engineering to educate on best practices: how to write efficient database queries, patterns for more performant tasks, identify performance bottlenecks for large customer accounts (i.e. how to write derby components performantly)<br></li></ul>Lever builds software for teams to source, interview, and hire top talent. Our team strives to set a new bar for enterprise software with modern, well-designed, real-time apps. We participated in Y Combinator in summer 2012, and since then have raised $33 million. This year, we're doubling the team in size, and we're looking forward to supporting more great companies like Netflix, Eventbrite, and Shopify.<br><br>Under the hood, we're a technology company with a powerful open-source web framework: DerbyJS. It is the first and only open-source MVC framework that syncs all data via an Operational Transformation backend, using the same algorithm that powers Google Docs. DerbyJS is also uniquely optimized to render everything on the server as well as the client.<br><br>Lever is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.<br><br>A look into life at Lever!<br><br>APPLY FOR THIS JOB<br><br>Lever is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.

title: Lead .Net Developer
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Sports Betting Company Looking For a Front End Developer</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Caitlin Johnson<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $90,000 - $150,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are pushing the boundaries of AI. An exciting new AI company founded with the goal of democratizing state-of-the-art AI. The AI Acceleration Platform optimizes the biggest ML models to be smaller, faster, and cheaper so companies can easily access and scale towards the best performance. Imagine a day where large language models like T5 or GPT-3 are used everywhere - that’s our vision. We are a team of ML engineers and researchers helping make ML more effective by implementing and advancing the latest research in AI for AI and hardware-software optimizations.<p><br></p>We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p>We are a spin-off from research at Harvard University conducted through support of the NSF, DARPA, Intel, IBM, ARM, Samsung, TSMC and others. Started with support from Harvard University Physical Sciences and Engineering Accelerator Award and Harvard Allston Venture Fund, we are backed by executives from top tech companies such as Google, Twitter, Yelp, etc. and VCs including three from the top 10 list.<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Computer Science degree or qualification in a related field</li><li> Minimum 2 years of experience related to this role</li><li> Solid experience in Javascript/HTML/CSS including ReactJS and NodeJS</li><li> Experience in NoSQL, REST and microservices architecture</li><li> Proficiency in written and spoken English</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develop clean web interactions using React</li><li> Create and maintain API endpoints integrated with the system</li><li> Help design and build the tech stack to ensure high system scalability and reliability</li><li> Manage specification, development, testing and releasing of new features</li></ul><p><br></p>You Are a Good Fit If You Have<p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive experience in designing, developing, or maintaining scalable web services</li><li> Experience working on large-scale systems and enterprise software</li><li> Expertise in application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines</li><li> Familiarity with CI/CD tools and deployment processes</li><li> Understanding best practices and current trends.</li></ul><p><br></p>Strong Pluses<p><br></p><ul><li> Past experience working at a SaaS company</li><li> Experience working with Amazon Web Services</li></ul><p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

description: <span><span><strong>TITLE: </strong>Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst - 23-12037<br><strong><span>LOCATION: </span></strong><span>Arlington Heights, IL area<br></span><strong><span>STATUS: </span></strong><span>Hybrid (2 days in office, 3 days remote) <br></span> <br><strong><span>OVERVIEW OF THE POSITION:</span></strong> <span>A global automotive and industrial parts manufacturing company is partnering with TeamBradley to add a Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst to their team.  This person will be part of the financial modules/JD Edwards Enterprise. The right candidate will have a strong knowledge of financial functions and JDE Integration. <br></span> <br><strong><span>BRIEF SNAPSHOT:</span></strong></span></span><ul><li><span><span>Provide support for sales and manufacturing plants. </span></span></li><li><span><span>Troubleshoot software issues and impellent technical solutions.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Implement the JDE Financial module.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Bachelor’s degree. </span></span></li><li><span><span>Strong knowledge in JD Edwards AR, AP &amp; G/L.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Knowledge of Manufacturing Accounting/Cost Accounting.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Knowledgeable in creating JDE E1 Pages, Watchlists, Alerts, JDE Café One, and JDE UX One.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Familiar with Hubble Financial.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Strong SQL &amp; Excel skills.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Familiarity with JDE Distribution, Procurement, and Manufacturing is a plus.</span></span></li><li><span><span>Familiar with IBM Query/400 a plus. </span></span></li></ul><span><span> <strong>WHEN RESPONDING TO THIS OPPORTUNITY:</strong> Resumes without the required technical skills and experience will not be considered.  Although a strong desire for a certain type of position is a credit to your goal, experience is necessary. Our client is not considering sponsorship currently and is not open to relocation expenses.<br><strong>Sr JDE Financial Business Systems Analyst - 23-12037<br></strong> <br></span></span><strong><span><span>#IND1</span> <br></span></strong>

title: Property Systems Technical Engineer
description: <p>This will be our client's first specialized Frontend Developer hire. They are a self funded growth stage startup, with mobile and web apps built using C#, .NET, and React Native. They are looking to bring on a Frontend Expert - someone that can advise all frontend decisions and implement development using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. If you are someone that fits this, and maybe you even have prior experience working with modern technologies like React or Angular, apply directly for immediate consideration! <br><br></p><p><strong>Client Details<br><br></strong></p><p>Our client is a growth stage self funded startup based just north of the city of Chicago. They have created a sports management system that powers scheduling and payments for sports organizations across the US. <br><br></p><p><strong>Description<br><br></strong></p><p>This Frontend Developer will act as the expert of all frontend development on projects and initiaives. This individual will contribute code in bi-weekly agile sprints, help CTO and other Sr Leaders plan long term vision and strategy, and have the opportunity to step up to a team leadership role as the frontend team grows long-term. <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>This team member will be expected to be Hybrid 1x/week out of their Highland Park, IL office. <br><br></p><p><strong>Profile<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>6-8 years of Frontend Development experience </li><li>Technologies: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React </li><li>Agile experience </li><li>Team first mentality </li><li>Strong communication skills </li></ul><p><strong>Job Offer<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Base salary no less than 140K, open for the right candidate </li><li>80-85% of all healthcare out of pocket costs covered </li><li>6% 401k match </li><li>Unlimited PTO (avg 5 weeks) </li><li>Office closed last 2 weeks of calendar year </li><li>Metra commuter benefits <br></li></ul><p><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em></p>

title: Backend Engineer II
description: <strong>Senior Mendix Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Chicago, IL</strong><p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop, and maintain Mendix applications for enterprise customers, ensuring high-quality and scalable solutions.</li><li>Collaborate with business analysts, stakeholders, and project managers to gather requirements, define project scope, and propose technical solutions.</li><li>Translate business requirements into technical specifications and create detailed technical designs.</li><li>Implement best practices for Mendix development, including module structure, microflows, and data modelling.</li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, maintainability, and performance optimization.</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues in Mendix applications, working closely with the support team and stakeholders.</li><li>Develop and execute unit tests to ensure the reliability and functionality of developed modules.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including UI/UX designers and backend developers, to deliver integrated solutions.</li><li>Provide technical guidance and mentorship to junior developers, assisting them in their professional growth.</li><li>Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in Mendix and related technologies, and apply them to improve development practices.</li><li>Communicate effectively with stakeholders, including clients, project managers, and team members, to gather requirements, provide updates, and address concerns.</li><li>Participate in Agile development processes, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.</li><li>8+ years of overall IT industry experience.</li><li>3+ years of hands-on experience in developing Mendix applications for enterprise customers.</li><li>Strong understanding of Mendix development concepts, including domain models, microflows, and custom widgets.</li><li>Proficiency in Mendix Studio Pro and Mendix Platform, including deployment and testing.</li><li>Experience in integrating Mendix applications with external systems and APIs.</li><li>Solid understanding of software development best practices, including version control, code reviews, and automated testing.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot technical issues.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders and team members.</li><li>Ability to work independently and handle multiple projects simultaneously.</li><li>Experience working in an Agile development environment is preferred.</li><li>Mendix certification(s) is a plus.</li></ul>

title: Front End Developer
description: <strong>Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Identify the IT Landscape with regards to SuccessFactors </li><li> Work on Requirement analysis and Gap analysis to ensure all the functionalities are addressed. </li><li> Cooperate and support the solution architects and HR Hub team by advising the integration </li><li> required in SuccessFactors. </li><li> Involve in configuration and documentation for client. </li><li> Involve in the workshops for requirement gathering to understand the user stories. </li><li> Participate in Mapping of SF Employee Central and ERP fields as per client specification for Data Migration and Replication. </li><li> Exhibit expertise in using Infoporter Data Migration and Replication. </li><li> Involve in End to End process to migrate the cost center from SAP HCM to Employee Central </li><li> Involve in End to End process to migrate and replicate the foundation objects i.e., Position and Organizational data between SAP HCM and SF Employee Central </li><li> Create test data as per business requirement. </li><li> Participate in "Test Planning, Test case Design, Preparation of test scenarios, Preparation of Test data and Test Execution. </li><li> Work on Defect Categorization, Reporting, Retesting, and closure using JIRA. </li><li> Work on Employee Central Data Models and BCUI and modify as per the client requirements. </li><li> Configure several business rules as per client requirement. </li><li> Work on data Imports of Foundation, Generic Objects and employee data. </li><li> Implement BADI's to fill the gaps and push custom field data to satisfy business requirements. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Academic Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p>This position requires, at a minimum, a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Information Technology, or a combination of education and experience equating to the U.S. equivalent of a Bachelor's degree in one of the aforementioned subjects.<p><br></p>Software Developer

description: <strong>Job Role</strong><strong>:</strong> Adobe Campaign Classic Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Location</strong><strong>:</strong> Chicago, IL <strong>(Day 1 Onsite)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Duration:</strong> 06+ Contract<p><br></p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Need 10+ years of Experience</li><li>ACC, Adobe campaign, Adobe campaign Classic (Key word to search in resume)</li><li>Ability to successfully define outcomes, manage expectations, manage cross-functional initiatives and meet deadlines based on project requirements</li><li>Excellent understanding of Adobe Campaign products and Adobe Marketing Cloud</li><li>4+ years of experience building with Adobe Campaign Classic V7</li><li>Deep understanding f web technologies and ETL processes</li><li>Hands on experience in development</li><li>Experience with integration of Adobe Campaign with other modules like AEM, Target, Analytics etc.</li><li>Providing expertise and advice to clients on marketing best practices impacting the design and creation of AC (e.g., email marketing, omni-channel marketing, triggered and personalized campaign deliveries, campaign attribution)</li><li>System integration experience: web services (Soap, Rest).</li><li>Scripting languages</li><li>Extensive expertise in relational databases, data structures, creating data schema and querying language</li><li>Experience with writing SQL statements for data extraction</li><li>Understanding of direct marketing vernacular (e.g. modeling, segmentation, test design, control groups)</li><li>Understanding of data security and privacy technologies</li><li>Ability to manage performance and scalability</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>ROLES &amp; RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Leading the design and implementation of Adobe Campaign (AC) that will deliver on our customer’s business, functional, technical and customer experience goals</li><li>Working on implementation teams through the various stages of the project including: Assessment, Requirements, Design, Build, Testing, Reporting/Tracking, Training and Go-Live</li><li>Design and present innovative and cost-effective solutions to the customer drawing on the current marketing technology landscape and industry best practices to enable a seamless customer experience or customer journey for our clients</li><li>Helping clients with the IP Warming process where needed</li><li>Work closely with clients, developers, system administrators, project managers, business analysts and end users to build a state-of-the-art Digital Platform using Adobe &amp; Marketing Product Suite</li><li>Lead high-level design workshops</li><li>Define technical specifications for workflows and business rules</li><li>Support integration, system and user acceptance test and</li><li>Contribute to throughout leadership and/or process improvement initiatives through quarterly proposal submissions</li></ul>

title: Software Developer
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>We are looking for you to join our team as an Embedded Software Engineer based out of Rolling Meadows, IL.<br><br>As an Embedded Software Engineer at Northrop Grumman you will have a challenging and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our mission to deliver critical national defense products and capabilities for the warfighter. Our success is grounded in our ability to embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The successful candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a focus on team empowerment and shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous learning, and a culture of automation.<br><br>Northrop Grumman is looking to add to our talented team of Embedded Software Engineers. Our engineers are self-starters who are part of a team of software professionals developing world-class software to meet our customer's high expectations. The Embedded Software Engineer designs, develops, operates, and maintains software and firmware components and computing systems software to be applied to and integrated with engineering, scientific and manufacturing requirements. The individual shall apply the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the system development life cycle to support the generation of engineering applications and products within the Targeting Business Unit. This includes interfacing with customers, suppliers, application users and other technical and support personnel.<br><br>The ideal individual will have experience including the full software development life cycle, which includes requirements, design, coding, testing, and integration.<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualifications For Embedded Software Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in STEM discipline with 2+ years of experience or MS degree in STEM discipline or in lieu of degree an additional 4 years of related experience is required.</li><li>Familiar with Object Oriented Programming in C++</li><li>Familiarity with Software architecture (design patterns, objected oriented design)</li><li>Familiarity with scripting languages (Python, Bash, Batch, etc)</li><li>Familiarity with operating system concepts for embedded systems</li><li>Familiarity with software development methodologies and frameworks such as Waterfall Methodology and/or Agile</li><li>Familiarity with various version control systems (Git, Gitlabs, Github, Bitbucket, ClearCase. etc) and Agile software planning tools (Rally, Jira, etc)</li><li>Must have interim Secret clearance prior to start. Once started, must have the ability to obtain and maintain Secret security clearance.</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications </strong>:<br><ul><li>Experience with Object Oriented Programming in C++11</li><li>Knowledge in Software architecture (design patterns, objected oriented design)</li><li>Knowledge with scripting languages (Python, Bash, Batch, etc)</li><li>Experience with Software development methodologies and frameworks such as Waterfall Methodology and/or Agile</li><li>Experience Developing Embedded Software running Linux or VxWorks Operating Systems</li><li>Experience testing, debugging, and integrating Embedded Software on target hardware</li><li>Experience with complex systems of systems that utilize Parallel Processing, Multi-Threading, Distributed Processing, Multi-Core, System-on-Chip, and Secure Processing.</li><li>Active Secret Clearance</li><li>Differentiating characteristics include demonstrated leadership and teamwork capability, interpersonal communication skills and activities</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $81,000 USD - $121,600 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.
