title: Oracle Developer with Trino
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Join Northrop Grumman on our continued mission to push the boundaries of possible across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace. Enjoy a culture where your voice is valued and start contributing to our team of passionate professionals providing real-life solutions to our world's biggest challenges. We take pride in creating purposeful work and allowing our employees to grow and achieve their goals every day by Defining Possible. With our competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, we have the right opportunities to fit your life and launch your career today.<br><br><strong> The Payload and Ground Systems Division within the Northrop Grumman Space Systems pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter. Come be a part of our mission! <br><br></strong>We offer phenomenal learning opportunities, exposure to a wide variety of projects and customers, and a very friendly collaborative workplace. We are looking for self-motivated, proactive, and goal-oriented people to help us grow our services and become even better at what we do. Does this sound like you?<br><br>The Payload and Ground Systems Division (PGSD) has an immediate need for a Chief Engineer to lead and develop next generation space systems solutions. The chief engineer has technical authority for all aspects of engineering on all program elements (systems/hardware/software/ support/integration and test) and leads a multi-disciplined engineering team managing the technical performance of the product/program satisfying the allocated cost and schedule requirements. This specific role is to lead the development, manufacture, and sustainment of an optical system for space applications.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities For The Chief Engineer Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ensures that the program is adhering to sound engineering processes in the development, production, test and sustainment products for our customers and is compliant with company policy, procedures, and quality standards</li><li>Maintains cognizance over technical activities within program Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) and ensures horizontal integration of the best engineering practices across the company</li><li>The Chief Engineer is expected to mentor Senior IPT leaders as part of this position</li><li>The Chief Engineer typically supports large development/production programs with contract values up to $75M that have medium/high risks with established or state-of-the-art processes</li><li>Maintaining knowledge of current and developing technologies and developing strategies for their insertion into both legacy and next-generation sensors</li><li>Providing physics level and mission level subject matter expertise</li><li>Guiding system implementation approaches for operational concepts</li><li>Authoring technical documentation such as white papers, proposal technical volumes, program milestone briefings (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR, MRR,etc), systems engineering design documentation</li><li>Provide technical oversight to sub-contractors to ensure requirements and quality standards are met.</li><li>Coordinating requirements development</li><li>Hardware/software design oversight</li><li>Verification and validation test activities</li><li>Performing key systems engineering elements to meet a given program's requirements</li><li>Supporting the design and development of sensor system architectures</li><li>Performing functional analysis, timeline analysis, detailed trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications</li><li>Responsibility for close customer cooperation to ensure that requirements meet customer expectations</li><li>Providing presentations to customers and senior management, with tailored material based on the audience</li><li>Leading / overseeing technical work products developed by the larger engineering team, supporting design reviews and integration and test activities as needed</li><li>capability assessments to predict requirement compliance</li><li>functional algorithm development</li><li>risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li><li>generating and reporting system Technical Performance Measures</li><li>Interface development and documentation</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate has recent experience in the fields of Electro-Optical and Infrared Sensors (EO/IR), Fiber Optics, Laser physics, LiDAR, optical alignment, and development and manufacture of optical systems.<br><br>As the Chief Engineer, you will be expected to demonstrate the following behaviors:<br><br>Knowledge, Skills and Ability - Apply advanced technical principles, theories, and concepts. Contributes to the development of new principles and concepts.<br><br>Problem Solving - Work on unusually complex technical problems and provide solutions which are highly innovative and ingenious.<br><br>Discretion/Latitude - Works under consultative direction toward predetermined long-range goals and objectives. Assignments are often self-initiated. Determine and pursue courses of action necessary to obtain desired results. Work checked through consultation and agreement with others rather than by formal review of superior.<br><br>Impact - Develops advanced technological ideas and guides their development into a final product. Erroneous decisions or recommendations would typically result in failure to achieve critical organizational objectives and effect the image of the organization technological capability.<br><br>Liaison - Serves as organization spokesperson on advanced projects and/or programs. Acts as advisor to management and customers on advanced technical research studies and applications.<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS degree in BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 14+ years (or MS with 12+ years, or PhD with 9+ years) related experience</li><li>Theoretical knowledge of the System Engineering V-Model and hands on experience executing the systems engineering work flow on space programs</li><li>Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving skills, and creativity</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Team players with a strong work ethic and initiative to perform in a cross functional team</li><li>Demonstrated previous Systems Engineering leadership experience on major Government Systems Acquisitions </li><li>Ability and willingness to travel up to 15% </li><li>Ability to obtain Top Secret clearance with special access</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred</li><li>Knowledgeable in orbit planning in LEO, GEO, xGEO orbital regimes</li><li>Prior leadership experience in Chief Engineer role or equivalent</li><li>Subject matter expert in EO/IR, laser physics, LiDAR, optical alignment, and development and manufacture of optical systems</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Knowledgeable in space systems design and mission planning</li><li>Experience in development and earned value management of cost accounts and schedules as related to Systems Engineering tasks</li><li>Ability to monitor hardware and software design teams with critical insight to know when the teams are not on path to successful implementation and then be able help steer the team to a successful solution</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Agile development experience a plus</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $153,600 USD - $230,400 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.
description_json: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Join Northrop Grumman on our continued mission to push the boundaries of possible across land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace. Enjoy a culture where your voice is valued and start contributing to our team of passionate professionals providing real-life solutions to our world's biggest challenges. We take pride in creating purposeful work and allowing our employees to grow and achieve their goals every day by Defining Possible. With our competitive pay and comprehensive benefits, we have the right opportunities to fit your life and launch your career today.<br><br><strong> The Payload and Ground Systems Division within the Northrop Grumman Space Systems pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines engineering capabilities, and drives advances in various sciences. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter. Come be a part of our mission! <br><br></strong>We offer phenomenal learning opportunities, exposure to a wide variety of projects and customers, and a very friendly collaborative workplace. We are looking for self-motivated, proactive, and goal-oriented people to help us grow our services and become even better at what we do. Does this sound like you?<br><br>The Payload and Ground Systems Division (PGSD) has an immediate need for a Chief Engineer to lead and develop next generation space systems solutions. The chief engineer has technical authority for all aspects of engineering on all program elements (systems/hardware/software/ support/integration and test) and leads a multi-disciplined engineering team managing the technical performance of the product/program satisfying the allocated cost and schedule requirements. This specific role is to lead the development, manufacture, and sustainment of an optical system for space applications.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities For The Chief Engineer Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ensures that the program is adhering to sound engineering processes in the development, production, test and sustainment products for our customers and is compliant with company policy, procedures, and quality standards</li><li>Maintains cognizance over technical activities within program Integrated Product Teams (IPTs) and ensures horizontal integration of the best engineering practices across the company</li><li>The Chief Engineer is expected to mentor Senior IPT leaders as part of this position</li><li>The Chief Engineer typically supports large development/production programs with contract values up to $75M that have medium/high risks with established or state-of-the-art processes</li><li>Maintaining knowledge of current and developing technologies and developing strategies for their insertion into both legacy and next-generation sensors</li><li>Providing physics level and mission level subject matter expertise</li><li>Guiding system implementation approaches for operational concepts</li><li>Authoring technical documentation such as white papers, proposal technical volumes, program milestone briefings (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR, MRR,etc), systems engineering design documentation</li><li>Provide technical oversight to sub-contractors to ensure requirements and quality standards are met.</li><li>Coordinating requirements development</li><li>Hardware/software design oversight</li><li>Verification and validation test activities</li><li>Performing key systems engineering elements to meet a given program's requirements</li><li>Supporting the design and development of sensor system architectures</li><li>Performing functional analysis, timeline analysis, detailed trade studies, requirements allocation, and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications</li><li>Responsibility for close customer cooperation to ensure that requirements meet customer expectations</li><li>Providing presentations to customers and senior management, with tailored material based on the audience</li><li>Leading / overseeing technical work products developed by the larger engineering team, supporting design reviews and integration and test activities as needed</li><li>capability assessments to predict requirement compliance</li><li>functional algorithm development</li><li>risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li><li>generating and reporting system Technical Performance Measures</li><li>Interface development and documentation</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate has recent experience in the fields of Electro-Optical and Infrared Sensors (EO/IR), Fiber Optics, Laser physics, LiDAR, optical alignment, and development and manufacture of optical systems.<br><br>As the Chief Engineer, you will be expected to demonstrate the following behaviors:<br><br>Knowledge, Skills and Ability - Apply advanced technical principles, theories, and concepts. Contributes to the development of new principles and concepts.<br><br>Problem Solving - Work on unusually complex technical problems and provide solutions which are highly innovative and ingenious.<br><br>Discretion/Latitude - Works under consultative direction toward predetermined long-range goals and objectives. Assignments are often self-initiated. Determine and pursue courses of action necessary to obtain desired results. Work checked through consultation and agreement with others rather than by formal review of superior.<br><br>Impact - Develops advanced technological ideas and guides their development into a final product. Erroneous decisions or recommendations would typically result in failure to achieve critical organizational objectives and effect the image of the organization technological capability.<br><br>Liaison - Serves as organization spokesperson on advanced projects and/or programs. Acts as advisor to management and customers on advanced technical research studies and applications.<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS degree in BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 14+ years (or MS with 12+ years, or PhD with 9+ years) related experience</li><li>Theoretical knowledge of the System Engineering V-Model and hands on experience executing the systems engineering work flow on space programs</li><li>Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving skills, and creativity</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Team players with a strong work ethic and initiative to perform in a cross functional team</li><li>Demonstrated previous Systems Engineering leadership experience on major Government Systems Acquisitions </li><li>Ability and willingness to travel up to 15% </li><li>Ability to obtain Top Secret clearance with special access</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred</li><li>Knowledgeable in orbit planning in LEO, GEO, xGEO orbital regimes</li><li>Prior leadership experience in Chief Engineer role or equivalent</li><li>Subject matter expert in EO/IR, laser physics, LiDAR, optical alignment, and development and manufacture of optical systems</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Knowledgeable in space systems design and mission planning</li><li>Experience in development and earned value management of cost accounts and schedules as related to Systems Engineering tasks</li><li>Ability to monitor hardware and software design teams with critical insight to know when the teams are not on path to successful implementation and then be able help steer the team to a successful solution</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Agile development experience a plus</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $153,600 USD - $230,400 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: ETL Developer
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Greenville Data Center - It (5118626)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>Platform Reliability Engineer will help ensure service availability, identifying and automating manual processes, and bridging the gaps between product development teams and operations. Implementing operational improvements in availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitorChriing, incident response, patch management and capacity planning are all within scope for this role. Whether it's done through code, the introduction of modern tools, and/or better processes continuous improvement and efficiency is the goal.<p><br></p>You'll provide operational excellence with troubleshooting skills, ownership in supporting various Azure services<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Builds, manages, and operate Azure Core Services with automation and infrastructure as code</li><li> Manages, and operates the continuous delivery framework and tools, manages, and automates the lifecycle of the different platform components and help support product teams</li><li> Leverage cloud architecture, applying site reliability principles, full-stack troubleshooting skills across network, application, security, Identity, OS, Containers, on-prem, and distributed services layers.</li><li> Lead and set strategy, roadmap for cloud reliability and recommend best practices for Operations</li><li> Mentor the team members to follow the frameworks and guide them to accelerate delivery of projects</li><li> Provide reasoning about system &amp; application architecture as well as be comfortable looking at code and offering feedback on how it can be improved to increase reliability.</li><li> Identify opportunities and drive the implementation of automation to improve patch management, service health, manageability, reliability, and telemetry.</li><li> Own, triage, investigate and resolve service issues with an emphasis on broad communications, learning &amp; teaching throughout the process</li><li> Design process or technology solutions that monitor, identify, and resolve platform, system, deployment, and environmental issues both prior &amp; post production releases, and ensure measurable improvements against Service KPIs.</li><li> Drive Security and compliance aspects for services in accordance with Azure compliance requirements.</li><li> Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting and work towards Azure cost optimizations.</li><li> Create and document Runbooks, Operational procedures, and Standards on confluence</li><li> Communicate on a deeply technical level with product engineering, project management and product teams to improve and optimize products, improve infrastructure, and evolve services.</li><li> Work within a project management/agile scrum teams in a support role as part of a wider team</li><li> Remain current on new technologies, methods and procedures including, but not limited to, coding practices such as Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and Operational excellence/</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field</li><li> 8+ years of IT experience focused on infrastructure which includes server, storage, network, security, Identity</li><li> 4+ years of experience supporting, maintaining, and automating Azure environments</li><li> 3+ years of experience using IaC tools (ARM, Terraform, JSON,YAML, PowerShell, Github etc...)</li><li> Production experience in Cloud technologies - Azure IaaS, PaaS, networking, Azure functions, Azure automation and runbooks, workbooks, Insights, Security center, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics.</li><li> Ability to read, write, configure, design, and script end-to-end service telemetry, alerting and self-healing capabilities for platform services, lead the execution and ongoing management of services</li><li> Ability to work in an Extreme Programming environment and work in a paired programming/operating model, able to lead the team and help remove roadblocks</li><li> Able to facilitate diverse teams, multi-task, and work under pressure to meet aggressive schedule targets</li><li> Hands on experience with IaC tools like ADO, ARM, terraform, ansible, PowerShell, python, azcli, github</li><li> Experience in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning</li><li> Technical and Operational expertise in Windows/Linux/VMware/Hyper-V/AKS, SQL and N0-SQL DB's, IaaS, PaaS, FaaS, Data, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, Monitoring, Identity and Connectivity</li><li> Experience managing and maintaining code repos, build systems, and CICD pipelines</li><li> Experience in infrastructure and configuration as code, as well as service auto-scale capabilities.</li><li> Worked in Devops and Agile environments, Blend of both Development and SRE mindset</li><li> Systematic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.</li><li> Participate in on call rotation. Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li>Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li>Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li>Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li>Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li>Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake/</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certification in Azure Administrator -required, Azure DevOps -preferred, Azure Solutions Architect -preferred</li></ul><p><br></p>LI-RV1 #DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at .<p><br></p>For more information, visit .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306572_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023 Cloud Reliability Engineer<p><br></p>

title: C# or C++ Developer - Contract
description: <strong>Group 1001</strong><em> is a consumer-centric, technology-driven family of insurance companies on a mission to deliver outstanding value and operational performance by combining financial strength and stability with deep insurance expertise and a can-do culture. Group1001’s culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, communication, core business focus, risk management, and striving for outcomes. This goal extends to how we hire and onboard our most valuable assets – our employees.</em><p><br></p><strong>Company Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Clear Spring Health is part of Group One Thousand One (“Group1001”), a customer-centric insurance group whose mission is to make insurance more useful, intuitive and accessible so that everyone feels empowered to achieve financial security. Clear Spring Health is dedicated to helping seniors protect their health and well-being by providing Medicare Advantage plans in select counties of Colorado, Illinois, North Carolina, and Virginia, plus Georgia and South Carolina and offers Medicare Prescription Drug Plans in 42 states plus DC.<p><br></p><em>Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences.</em><p><br></p>The Digital Marketing Analyst will support the Marketing Department in the development, implementation, and maintenance of digital marketing campaigns. Will provide reporting and analytics on KPI’s, and insights to enhance performance and continued growth for online and offline channels including lead generation and funnel conversion optimization.<p><br></p>This position will also be responsible for the management of first, second- and third-party data for members and prospects. They will own the process for data integrity and will support the team on any data or analysis requests.<p><br></p><ul><li>Identify trends and apply new insights on all marketing campaigns including website performance utilizing google analytics.</li><li>Create and distribute reporting and analysis to key stakeholders.</li><li>Maintain awareness of competitive information and industry trends</li><li>Assist Marketing and cross functional teams in developing strategy based on analysis.</li><li>Stay up to date with marketing trends and best practices, and make recommendations for new marketing initiatives.</li><li>May participate in other marketing initiatives.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Must be proficient with Excel and Power Point</li><li>Google adwords and google analytics knowledge is a plus</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given</li></ul>

title: Adobe Campaign Classic Engineer
description: At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us. The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees' personal and professional lives. Position Summary: The Data Science team at Horizon Therapeutics is looking for an extraordinary Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting data science solutions that drive impact for patients. In this role you will be leveraging cutting edge artificial intelligence, algorithms, and technology to influence decisions across the organization. The role requires extensive knowledge of machine learning, the creativity to correctly identify opportunities for data science to be impactful, and a passion for the life sciences. You will assist matrixed teams across multiple therapeutic areas and commercial functions. This individual should be an expert at manipulating messy data and apply object-oriented design principles to automate outputs and datasets. The Data Scientist should be experienced in moving models from development to production, and have a good sense for tracking and updating model performance. Some key projects that the Data Scientist will support include physician targeting and segmentation, lead generation for our field sales teams, patient journey mapping and prediction, disease incidence and prevalence projection, and predicting patients likely to start therapy. Qualifications and Skills Required: BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning &amp; Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related technical discipline Masters degree in a relevant technical field or 1 year of relevant data science experience Strong working knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and a solid grounding in traditional algorithms like linear regression, tree models, probabilistic (Bayesian) approaches, and clustering Ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Expert proficiency with Python and SQL Experience with Pyspark, and familiarity working in a cloud-based technology stack Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Healthcare Datasets such as APLD claims and/or EMR/EHR records, as well as their respective nuances Experience in the commercial pharmaceutical space Experience working on data science projects in a production environment Our Values Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference. Accountability: We do what's right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures. Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients. These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one's team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better. Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
description_json: At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us. The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees' personal and professional lives. Position Summary: The Data Science team at Horizon Therapeutics is looking for an extraordinary Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting data science solutions that drive impact for patients. In this role you will be leveraging cutting edge artificial intelligence, algorithms, and technology to influence decisions across the organization. The role requires extensive knowledge of machine learning, the creativity to correctly identify opportunities for data science to be impactful, and a passion for the life sciences. You will assist matrixed teams across multiple therapeutic areas and commercial functions. This individual should be an expert at manipulating messy data and apply object-oriented design principles to automate outputs and datasets. The Data Scientist should be experienced in moving models from development to production, and have a good sense for tracking and updating model performance. Some key projects that the Data Scientist will support include physician targeting and segmentation, lead generation for our field sales teams, patient journey mapping and prediction, disease incidence and prevalence projection, and predicting patients likely to start therapy. Qualifications and Skills Required: BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning &amp; Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related technical discipline Masters degree in a relevant technical field or 1 year of relevant data science experience Strong working knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and a solid grounding in traditional algorithms like linear regression, tree models, probabilistic (Bayesian) approaches, and clustering Ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Expert proficiency with Python and SQL Experience with Pyspark, and familiarity working in a cloud-based technology stack Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Healthcare Datasets such as APLD claims and/or EMR/EHR records, as well as their respective nuances Experience in the commercial pharmaceutical space Experience working on data science projects in a production environment Our Values Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference. Accountability: We do what's right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures. Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients. title: Engineer Embedded Software
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Greenville Data Center - It (5118634)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose: </strong><p><br></p>Platform Reliability Engineer will help ensure service availability, identifying and automating manual processes, and bridging the gaps between product development teams and operations. Implementing operational improvements in availability, latency, performance, efficiency, change management, monitoring, incident response, patch management and capacity planning are all within scope for this role. Whether it's done through code, the introduction of modern tools, and/or better processes continuous improvement and efficiency is the goal.<p><br></p>You'll provide operational excellence with troubleshooting skills, ownership in supporting various Azure services<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Builds, manages, and operate Azure Core Services with automation and infrastructure as code</li><li> Manages, and operates the continuous delivery framework and tools, manages, and automates the lifecycle of the different cloud platform components and help support product teams</li><li> Leverage cloud architecture, applying site reliability principles, full-stack troubleshooting skills across network, application, security, Identity, OS, Containers, on-prem, and distributed services layers.</li><li> Provide reasoning about system &amp; application architecture as well as be comfortable looking at code and offering feedback on how it can be improved to increase reliability.</li><li> Identify opportunities and drive the implementation of automation to improve patch management, service health, manageability, reliability, and telemetry.</li><li> Own, triage, investigate and resolve service issues with an emphasis on broad communications, learning &amp; teaching throughout the process</li><li> Design process or technology solutions that monitor, identify, and resolve platform, system, deployment, and environmental issues both prior &amp; post production releases, and ensure measurable improvements against Service KPIs.</li><li> Drive Security and compliance aspects for services in accordance with Azure compliance requirements.</li><li> Engage in service capacity planning, demand forecasting and work towards Azure cost optimizations.</li><li> Create and document Runbooks, Operational procedures, and Standards on confluence</li><li> Communicate on a deeply technical level with product engineering, project management and product teams to improve and optimize products, improve infrastructure, and evolve services.</li><li> Work within a project management/agile scrum teams in a support role as part of a wider team</li><li> Remain current on new technologies, methods and procedures including, but not limited to, coding practices such as Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment and Operational excellence.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related field</li><li> 7+ years of IT experience focused on infrastructure which includes server, storage, network, security Identity</li><li> 3+ years of experience supporting, maintaining, and automating Azure environments</li><li> 2+ years of experience using IaC tools (ARM, Terraform, JSON,YAML, PowerShell, Github etc...)</li><li> Production experience in Cloud technologies - Azure IaaS, PaaS, networking, Azure functions, Azure automation and runbooks, workbooks, Insights, Security center, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics.</li><li> Ability to read, write, configure, design, and script end-to-end service telemetry, alerting and self healing capabilities for platform services</li><li> Ability to work in an Extreme Programming environment and work in a paired programming/operating model</li><li> Able to facilitate diverse teams, multi-task, and work under pressure to meet aggressive schedule targets</li><li> Hands on experience with IaC tools like ADO, ARM, terraform, ansible, PowerShell, python, azcli, github</li><li> Experience in service capacity planning, demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning</li><li> Technical and Operational expertise in Windows/Linux/VMware/Hyper-V/AKS, SQL and N0-SQL DB's, IaaS, PaaS FaaS, Data, BCDR, Security, Management, Storage, Networking, Monitoring, Identity and Connectivity</li><li> Experience managing and maintaining code repos, build systems, and CICD pipelines</li><li> Experience in infrastructure and configuration as code, as well as service auto-scale capabilities.</li><li> Worked in Devops and Agile environments, Blend of both Development and SRE mindset</li><li> Systematic problem-solving and troubleshooting skills coupled with a strong sense of ownership and drive.</li><li> Participate in on call rotation. Participate, collaborate, and provide guidance in retrospectives.</li><li> At least 4 years of hands-on operational experience supporting the following or related experience:</li><li>Azure Virtual Network, VWAN, Express route, Load Balancer (L4/L7), Traffic Manager, CDN, Azure DNS, routing &amp; routing protocols like BGP, firewall concepts</li><li>Azure Identity including any of the following: Azure AD, PIM, Conditional Access, MFA, Azure AD Connect, Password less sign-ins, Microsoft Defender, key vault</li><li>Azure Governance, Security, Monitoring, Workbooks, Compliance, and cost awareness</li><li>Azure Virtual Machines, Containers and/or Kubernetes and/or OpenShift (infrastructure perspective)</li><li>Azure Storage Account, Disk, Snapshot, Backup, Site Recovery, file sync, Data Lake.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Certifications in Azure Administrator, Azure DevOps, Azure Solutions Architect.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at .<p><br></p>For more information, visit .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 306569_external_USA-IL-Chicago_6152023 Cloud Platform Engineer - AZURE<p><br></p>

title: IFM Product Manager Business Analyst
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options.<p><br></p>Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge of engineering principles and practices in engineering to support NPD, sustaining, and productivity designs that have limited complexity. This role will be heavily involved in developing test procedures, test strategies, outlining test automation initiatives, and some understanding of the principles in reliability testing.<p><br></p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for creating, maintaining, and executing test plans on hardware and software of Chamberlain products</li><li>Estimating test effort, analyzing, and communicating test results, tracking defects, and participating in gauge R&amp;R studies</li><li>Participates as a key core team member on new product development teams, along with productivity and sustaining projects, attends design reviews, and day-to-day Agile scrum activities</li><li>Works with regulatory engineers to set-up and conduct test plans for UL agency-type testing.</li><li>Prepares and reviews test reports for projects and assists other TEs with their projects.</li><li>Directs the operation of a variety of computer automated and manual test equipment including data acquisition systems, environmental chambers, RF chambers, acoustics chambers, EMC test equipment, electrical test instrumentation, vibration systems, and assorted measurement transducers.</li><li>Evaluates the results of EMC testing of RF emissions, RF sensitivity, radiated and conducted immunity, and RF electrical safety evaluation.</li><li>Participate in defect analysis, root cause analysis, study product functionality impact, and provide key insight of observed product performance and defects.</li><li>Works with Manager to establish new test procedures, testing methodologies, and provides input for custom test fixture design and automation projects.</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities; an advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>3+ years of job-related experience with Bachelor’s degree in engineering</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Job Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>LIMS software experience; Six Sigma Yellow Belt certification; familiarity with general MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, Visio, and Project</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross-functional teams to facilitate the creation of electro-mechanical products; analytical skills to support design creation of electro-mechanical systems by completing calculations involving statics, confidence and reliability testing, technical writing, and laying out Gantt and flow charts; conducting Anova GRR; good presentation skills; strong analytical skills</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Space TS/SCI - Staff Engineer Systems - Chief Engineer (Up to $15K Sign On Bonus)
description: <ul><li>Company with sports and technology at its core - with mobile and web apps|Fullstack opportunity using C#, ASP.NET, React with small team of 6 developers<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 1M onboarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Selected Software Developer will:<br><ul><li>Use React Native for all mobile development projects.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Develop client displays and user interfaces in a Fullstack capacity.</li><li>Perform complete testing of web applications-unit and end-to-end automated testing, engaging users as necessary.</li><li>Develop SQL database-driven web interfaces.</li><li>Utilize front-end web technologies to create interactive user experiences with rich functionality.</li><li>Take charge of story development without needing micromanagement.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The Successful Software Developer has:<br><ul><li>4+ years of Fullstack experience.</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Boot camp certificate (with at least 2 additional years of experience).</li><li>Strong proficiency with React Native.</li><li>Exposure or experience working in C#/.NET is highly preferred but not required.</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - title: Cloud Reliability Engineer
description: <strong>Looking for: Tandem Developer</strong> <strong>Location: Rosemont, IL</strong><p><br></p>Must have: <strong>Expertise in COBOL, SCOBOL, NSQL (SQL/MP, SQL/MX), Enscribe, Pathway, EINSPECT/DEBUG, FUP, SCUP and TACL, TMF, BATCHCOM, SPOOLCOM.</strong><p><br></p>Should have 5 to 10+ years of working experience in <strong>Tandem Application programming</strong>.<p><br></p><strong>Expertise in COBOL, SCOBOL, NSQL (SQL/MP, SQL/MX), Enscribe, Pathway, EINSPECT/DEBUG, FUP, SCUP and TACL, TMF, BATCHCOM, SPOOLCOM.</strong><p><br></p>Intermediate knowledge of OSS, TAL, and Financial transactions (ACH).<p><br></p>Good to have knowledge of core Java programming and Web Services.<p><br></p><strong>Nice to have the below skill set, but not mandatory:</strong><p><br></p>Need at least one: Windows server / Linux / Unix<p><br></p>Need at least one: Java / Java Script / C / VB / C# / C++<p><br></p>Need at least one: Snowflake / SQL Server / Oracle / MySQL<p><br></p>TAL experience would be nice<p><br></p>Cloud experience would be nice, specifically S3 / Snowflake / AWS.

title: Data Scientist II
description: Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage and maintain global enterprise platforms, ensuring their smooth operation and availability.</li><li>Maintain templates for monitoring systems.</li><li>Implement monitoring best practices for AWS cloud, optimizing system health and performance.</li><li>Coordinate with DevOps and Problem Management teams to support monitoring and resolve escalations.</li><li>Manage capacity planning, updates, upgrades, and internal integration of systems.</li><li>Administer monitoring tools in the APM space, ensuring uptime, availability, and accurate reporting.</li><li>Mentor and train support personnel on using monitoring tools effectively.</li><li>Stay updated on current technology trends, evaluate new technologies, and attend relevant events and training sessions.</li><li>Perform other assigned duties and responsibilities as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p>Required Qualifications - Knowledge/Skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>8+ years of experience in Information Technology.</li><li>4+ years of experience running production systems on AWS.</li><li>Proficiency in Datadog and experience with site monitoring and log monitoring tools.</li><li>Certified AWS SysOps Administrator is a plus.</li><li>Familiarity with DynamoDB, S3, and Cognito.</li><li>Good understanding of Serverless architecture and CloudFormation.</li><li>Knowledge of best practices for AWS, EC2, Couchbase, and container monitoring.</li><li>Familiarity with configuration management software like Ansible.</li><li>Ability to manage overall application availability, latency, and system health monitoring.</li><li>Strong troubleshooting skills and understanding of systems and networks.</li><li>Experience with Windows Server, IIS, Docker, and Kubernetes.</li><li>Proficient in automated build pipelines and continuous integration practices.</li><li>Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively communicate with different stakeholders.</li><li>Strong teamwork skills, collaborating effectively with colleagues and contributing positively to discussions.</li></ul><p><br></p>Please note that the job duties and responsibilities may change over time, and additional tasks may be assigned as required.

title: Cloud Platform Engineer - AZURE
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Senior (Sr.) Principal Systems Engineer depending on qualifications and years of experience. This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location. This opportunity is available in the Systems Design discipline in SEIT. Duties and responsibilities can include:<br><ul><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>Generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate is a subject matter expert (SME) in the field of communication system and antenna design. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialty areas in regards to antenna design.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas related to EOIR/RF systems: antennas, transmitters &amp; receivers, sensors, and optics</li><li>Communication hardware, software, and system</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a System Design Engineer is exposed to the front-end Systems Engineering process and coordinate across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong>Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>For Sr. Principal Systems Engineer, BS degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical degree with 9+ years (or MS with 7+ years, or PhD with 4+ years) related experience</li><li>Demonstrated proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and the ability to work in an integrated product team (IPT) environment</li><li>Active or Current Top Secret Clearance is required to be considered</li><li>Must have the ability to obtain SCI level access</li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and experience in antenna design</li><li>Familiarity with orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Working knowledge of DOORS</li><li>Recent experience in requirements allocation &amp; derivation, and verification traceability</li><li>Model Based Systems Engineering experience, especially in Cameo</li><li>Agile development experience, including use of Atlassian products</li><li>Ability and willing to travel</li><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI and polygraph</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $120,000 USD - $180,000 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: React Native Mobile Developer - Hybrid
description: In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of <em>One team, One Kroll</em>, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel.<br><br>Kroll Digital Services (KDS) is Kroll’s digital-first business unit, delivering risk and financial intelligence via technology to the world’s leading companies and financial institutions. We blend the best of both worlds; the agility and experimentation of a start-up, with the stability and backing of an enterprise. We are ambitious in both our mission and our culture.<br><br>The FinTech arm of KDS was recently brought together with some of the industry’s leading experts to build cutting edge applications and data products that will revolutionize the way private markets professionals analyze and manage illiquid assets.<br><br>You will be a critical member of the KDS team, helping to design and create leading-edge solutions for our clients.<br><br><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES: <br></strong><ul><li>Develop technology driven financial platforms to solve client problems</li><li>Build these platforms from the ground up with a global team</li><li>Determine and help build appropriate pipelines to deploy high quality code in mission-critical production environments</li><li>Continually improve the reliability, stability, and performance of production engineering processes that power the product offering</li><li>Beyond engineering, strive to learn the business context to quickly play a leading role in solving problems and driving decisions<br><br></li></ul><strong>REQUIREMENTS: <br></strong><ul><li>BA/BS degree in computer science or relevant degree or work experience</li><li>Experience in building public facing API’s or ones that powered web applications</li><li>2+ years of application development experience with .NET and C#</li><li>2+ years of experience with Web services (SOAP, REST) &amp; Web API / Integrations</li><li>2+ years of experience with one of the following: Swagger, Postman, MuleSoft or Kong</li><li>2+ years of experience with Database design / development</li><li>Strong in Object Oriented Programming, MVC, Design patterns and SOLID principles</li><li>Experience in building &amp; hosting applications on the Cloud</li><li>Experience with version control tools</li><li>Experience with CI-CD pipelines using Azure DevOps or comparable tools</li><li>Experience with app. lifecycle management using Azure DevOps or comparable tools</li><li>Excellent communication skills in written and oral English</li><li>Familiarity with Scrum and Agile methodologies<br><br></li></ul><strong>Skills to be outstanding:<br></strong><ul><li>Experience in the financial industry, specifically capital markets, asset management, or private market technology</li><li>Experience with deploying and managing services using container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes or Docker</li><li>Experience delivering and receiving content as JSON</li><li>Experience with frameworks like React, Angular, ES6+, NodeJS, Typescript</li><li>Experience with HTML5, CSS, Bootstrap, and other related frameworks</li><li>Experience in building solutions with monitoring, logging, security, and high availability considerations</li><li>Experience in developing solutions that require data isolation for privacy</li><li>Experience with Azure services including App Services, Azure Functions, Web Jobs, Key Vault, Storage (blob), App Insights</li><li> Experience designing, developing, and maintaining Excel and other add-ins for platforms selling into the financial industry</li><li>Technical certifications (especially in Cloud Technologies)</li><li>Experience with Auth0 / Azure Active Directory / IAM<br><br></li></ul>In order to be considered for a position at Kroll, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com<br><br><em>Kroll is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants regardless of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.<br><br></em>The current salary range for this position is $90,000 - $150,000.<br><br>#dice<br><br>

title: Tandem Developer
description: This client has created an innovative search and booking engine that helps customers find the best ways to use their travel points and miles. Not only have they been ranked 5/5 stars as the best booking service of 2021, but they also have also been advertised by Forbes, The New York Times, ABC and more!<p><br></p>It searches 30+ loyalty and 100+ airline programs to find the best value possible.<p><br></p>They find the best flights for your points - including seats the airlines don't advertise. Then they show your options side-by-side, so you know you're getting the best deal.<p><br></p>They emphasize diversity and are crafting an inclusive, collaborative, and exciting culture for their team members to grow with.<p><br></p>They have multiple openings including Mid and Senior level roles. As a Full Stack Java Engineer, you will build a consumer website by developing sophisticated algorithms and highly available systems to offer best-in-class services to their customers. You will help build the systems and algorithms that power their services, scale those systems for growth, and continuously improve their engineering practice! You will be leveraging Java, Spring Boot, React, and CI/CD pipelines while deploying into AWS using Docker.<p><br></p><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science or something complementary </li><li>2-5 years of experience in Software Development </li><li>Strong experience with AWS </li><li>Docker/Kubernetes </li><li>React </li><li>CICD using Jenkins </li><li>Testing experience using either Cucumber or Selenium preferably </li></ul> <strong>The Offer</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Health Insurance Benefits </li><li>Dental Benefits </li><li>Vision Benefits </li><li>PTO Minimum of 15 Days </li><li>Team Outings and Trips </li></ul> Full Stack Engineer/Stable SaaS Company/Fully Remote<p><br></p>

title: Tandem Developer
description: <strong>GENERAL SUMMARY: </strong>The role of the Full Stack Web Developer (FSWD) is to assist with Chicago Booth departments that are looking to launch new websites and provide innovative digital solutions under the direction of the Director, Front End Web Development. The Full Stack Web Developer continually evolves and maintains a fresh, functional, compelling web and digital marketing presence that clearly conveys the University of Chicago’s Booth School of Business (Chicago Booth) brand image. The ideal candidate will work closely with the Sr. Web Developer to understand project objectives and assess the technical and digital requirements. This individual will assist in all aspects of the web development cycle, which includes implementation, documentation, testing, deployment, Sitecore builds and support. Learn new technologies and methodologies; and utilize a pixel-perfect attention to quality when using their front-end development skills.<p><br></p><strong>PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Builds, maintains, and enforces a high-quality, standards-based, and seamlessly integrated online presence for Chicago Booth, including, but not limited to, websites and microsites, social media outlets, mobile presence, blogs, and emails.</li><li>Works closely with team to implement new design features.</li><li>Follows best practices for the full web development life cycle, including adhering to coding standards, setting up and maintaining builds for continuous integration, designing and coding enterprise framework components, performing code reviews and SEO best practices.</li><li>Converts mockups into functional website.</li><li>Optimizes front-end code for speed and performance.</li><li>Creates accessible (ADA compliant), WCAG compliant interfaces.</li><li>Continually monitors Chicago Booth’s online presence for accuracy, consistency, and technical problems and escalate issues to resolution.</li><li>Helps to optimize and implement code to support successful ongoing website analytics capture and reporting requirements.</li><li>Collaborates with the Marketing Manager for metrics to support and provide strategic direction on continued refinement of analytics implementation.</li><li>Performs and facilitates quality assurance checks on web development projects.</li><li>Helps to maintain and develop documentation for all web development project deliverables and ensure ease of use for end-users.</li><li>Creates and maintains email marketing system templates and data.</li><li>Designs new systems, features, and tools. Solves complex problems and identifies opportunities for technical improvement and performance optimization. Reviews and tests code to ensure appropriate standards are met.</li><li>Acts as a technical consultant and resource for faculty research, teaching, and/or administrative projects.</li><li>Performs other related work as needed.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND EXPERIENCE:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field.</li><li>A minimum five years professional experience in web development.</li><li>Modern Browser development fundamentals including HTML/ CSS/ JS.</li><li>Responsive design, web standards and UI/UX best practices.</li><li>Optimize front-end code for speed and performance.</li><li>Proficiency with Adobe CS.</li><li>Knowledge of WCAG, W3C standards and SEO technical principles.</li><li>Full stack LAMP, MEAN or MERN project completion.</li><li>Experienced with one or more front-end javascript libraries, including but not limited to JQuery, ANgular JS or React JS.</li><li>Familiarity with web analytics tools and concepts (Google Analytics, Adobe Launch).</li><li>Familiarity with email marketing systems (i.e. Marketo, Slate), including developing email templates and testing HTML emails for various platforms.</li><li>Interacting with RESTful web service.</li><li>Solid Understanding of converting HTML templates into editable Sitecore templates using Microsoft.net MVC.</li><li>.net using C# or similar server-side programming language.</li><li>Convert mockups into functional website.</li><li>QA work and others and demonstrate a strong attention to detail.</li><li>Excellent problem solving and time management skills.</li><li>This position is currently expected to work a minimum three days per week in the office.</li><li>Resume/CV (required)</li><li>Cover Letter (required)</li></ul><p><br></p>The University of Chicago is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity/Disabled/Veterans Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, age, status as an individual with a disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or other protected classes under the law. For additional information, please see the University’s Notice of Nondiscrimination. Academic job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call or email with their request. Staff Job seekers in need of a reasonable accommodation to complete the application process should call or email with their request.
